It is a complete remake of the 1998 Game Boy Color game, Dragon Quest Monsters: Terry's Wonderland.

The gameplay is reminiscent to Dragon Quest Monsters: Joker 2. The battle system, battle menu, and scouting system from Joker 2 is making a return in this remake of the first Dragon Quest Monsters game.

The game features include shifting from day to night, randomized dungeon layouts, combat with four opponents on each side, and a total of 609 monsters, including all the monsters from the original Game Boy Color release.The game also features an in-game Wi-Fi Store in the bazaar area. The Wi-Fi Store purchases can be made with the in-game currency, gold. The store's items changes daily, and the days Wi-Fi item store is only open after doing that day's Wi-Fi Ranking Battle. It can be used to buy monster eggs, (white, silver, and rainbow eggs) skill books, consumable items, and some weapons. Players have the ability to import monsters they have raised from Dragon Quest Monsters: Joker 2 and Dragon Quest Monsters: Joker 2 Professional (Rank A and higher only) through a free app upon completion of the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dragon Quest Monsters: Terry's Wonderland 3D", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

118203.name: Panda Darake
118203.description:
A balance game featuring everyone's pandas in different poses.

Set up the wobbling tire on a table or floor and then take it in turns to place one of 12 Panda figures onto it using the chopsticks provided. Make sure you balance carefully and don't let the Pandas come tumbling off!

The game is aimed at children but is challenging enough for adults to play, especially in lighthearted settings.

It comes with numerous play options and mini games and puzzles.

Game Contents


12 Panda figure (the second edition adds 2 much smaller baby Panda figures)
1 Tire
1 Base Stand
Chopsticks

118204.name: Karaoke Revolution: Glee
118204.description:
Calling all "Gleeks!" For the very first time, fans will get a chance to perform their hearts out in this year's version of Karaoke Revolution Glee. Belt it out to chart-topping Glee tunes, reenacct scenes with friends and family, take center stage and own the moment on Wii this fall!

Source: The Game Website.

118205.name: Dragon's Crown
videogamehonor: 2013 Operation Rainfall Awards Best PlayStation Console Game of the Year Nominee
118205.description:
Like Odin Sphere and Muramasa: The Demon Blade, it is a spiritual successor to an Atlus game titled Princess Crown and takes some concepts from Norse mythology.

Dragon's Crown is an action role-playing game structured like a traditional side-scrolling beat 'em up where players move their characters across the screen into the background or foreground attacking enemies. Players may choose between one of six characters--Fighter, Amazon, Elf, Sorceress, Wizard, and Dwarf--who must travel though a number of environments using standard attacks as well as magic spells to defeat enemies.

The game takes place in a fantasy world where vast labyrinths and catacombs lie beneath civilization. Magic-users seeking a legendary treasure know as the "Dragon's Crown" have used their sorcery to link each of the ruins together in order to search for it, which they plan to use for a sinister purpose. Players must take up the role of one of six adventurers to keep the crown out of their hands, as well as search for treasure of their own.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dragon's Crown (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

118206.name: Dust: An Elysian Tail
videogamehonor: 2012 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Download Only Game of the Year Nominee
2012 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Hero of the Year Nominee
2012 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Xbox Game of the Year Winner
2012 Operation Rainfall Awards Game of the Year Nominee
2012 Spike Best Independent Game of the Year Nominee
2013 D.I.C.E. Role-Playing Game of the Year Nominee
2013 Game Developers Choice Awards Best New IP of the Year Nominee
2013 Global Game Awards Best RPG of the Year Nominee
2013 IGF Awards Excellence In Audio Nominee
118206.description:
Dust takes place in the world of Falana, inhabited by anthropomorphic animals. Gameplay is presented on a 2D side-scrolling plane. The player controls the titular main character, Dust, as he tries to remember his past. Dust wields a sentient sword, the Blade of Ahrah, as his main weapon. Fidget, the sword's guardian, acts as a companion for Dust and can shoot projectiles.

As the player travels the world, they can acquire power-ups that permanently alter gameplay, such as the ability to double jump or climb to previously unreachable areas. Incorporating elements of role-playing games, Dust can gain experience points by defeating enemies, and in turn may level up. These can be used to raise various attributes, such as health, strength or magic. Non-playable characters can be interacted with throughout the game's world to sell items or receive quests.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dust: An Elysian Tail", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

118207.name: Victory Decision: World War II
boardgamepodcastepisode: Meeples & Miniatures - Episode 79 - Napoleon at War, Enduring Freedom & Victory Decision
118207.description:
Victory Decision: World War II is an action based game that allows you to command a platoon sized force or more in this momentous conflict. It features a unique Leadership-modified alternate unit activation system. The result is a fun and fast paced war game that involves both players almost constantly. These rules cover virtually all aspects of World War II gaming. This rulebook not only provides Scenarios but also Point based Army Lists for late war British, German, Soviet and US forces. All necessary Game Markers are also included within this book.

This rule system is written with individually based 28 or 20mm miniatures in mind. However, scale is not important in "Victory Decision: World War II". As long as your minis are individually based you can use the rules straight away. In fact we found that the weapon ranges look more realistic when using individually based 15mm infantry miniatures. If you want to play with smaller tables, just use centimeters instead of inches and all will be fine.

Using individually based infantry miniatures is the recommended way of playing "Victory Decision: World War II".

118208.name: Skepp ohoj
118208.description: Old swedish game published by Aristogame. The goal of the game is to transport gargo from all over the world back home to Sweden. It is a simple roll-and-move game and each player has their own ship that they move around on the board to reach all continents. Each continent has some plastic chips representing goods that you brin back home.

118209.name: Campingspelet
118209.description:
Old swedish cardgame about camping.
Published by Charts before 1950.

The game consist of cards in for colors between 1-11. The first players starts with playing one card and the other player must play a card in hte same color. The highest card wins. The goal is to win as many and high card as possible but at the same ttime avoid all nines. In the end the one whit the least nines wins. If two players has the same amount of nines the one with highest cards win.

118210.name: DausendDodeDrolle (Issue 7 - 1996)
118210.description:
This issue with the first full-color cover contains an adventure "Das Blutgemach"
It also contains a map (A3) for the "Sturminseln"

118212.name: WarGames: DefCon 1
118212.description:
Back of the Box

WarGames Defcon 1 is an action packed all out fragfest designed specifically for Playstation
- 32 ground, sea and air attack units
- The ability to command upto 8 units at once
- 3D Terrain & weather which affects yoyr troops movements
- 30 campaign based mission. Command NORAD or WOPR
- Groundbreaking split screen two player option (versus or cooperative modes)
- Analog Controller (DUALSHOCK) Compatible

118213.description:
In Capua players try to make a name and fortune with gladiators.
Buy gladiators and send them into the arena to win victories for the Lanista and fortune and honor to his Ludus.

The game takes place in four phases
- Auction of gladiators
- Fighting in arena
- Negotiation
- Maintenance of ludus

An auction game, where we must be careful what gladiators opponents are recruiting, and what they might plan to do with them.

A fighting game, where through the dices players give order to the gladiators.

A game of negotiation, where the alliances can cover some lanista with gold - but not for long, as a rich Ludus covet the treacherous eyes of others. And in the end only one can win.

An easy game to learn and play, with a dynamic auction, combat and negotiation that never becomes repetitive, and where alliances shift like the roll of a die.

Dare to be the best lanista of Capua! Conduct the Gladiators to Glory!
118213.name: CAPUA

118214.description:
Moral Conflict 1940 is a strategic team game played by 2 to 6 players, which powerfully reconstructs the military, economic, diplomatic, technological and moral conflict as it enveloped the globe in course of the Second World War. It is possible to learn and practice not just teamwork, but also strategy, negotiation, planning and focus to achieve victory. This is a streamlined 12-sided dice version, ideal for play from 90 minutes by experienced gamers.

Victory points are collected in the beginners´game like many one dimensional military games, by capturing territories and defeating the other players. In the advanced game it is possible to play and win through the further four dimensions.

FIRST the military war of great land, sea and air battles.

SECOND the economic crisis, the struggle for economic growth and access to critical oil and iron ore resources. The price of military war is clearly seen and the player who amasses much wealth can win even without fighting.

THIRD the diplomatic pressure to coerce neutral nations into trade or conflict. The excitement of winning a major ally such as the Soviet Union and the pain if they change sides.

FOURTH the race to develop new war or economic technologies, such as jet aircraft, radar, rocketry or more efficient manufacturing through prefabrication and standardisation.

FIFTH the moral decisions which shaped each nation´s conduct. Seizing power through violence and treachery is contrasted with close cooperation, trust, sharing and self-sacrifice in search for peace.

The interplay of all five dimensions on each other is the unique Moral Conflict experience. Each game progresses differently with almost unlimited options.

An extra guide book, with historical background, teaches strategy in five dimensions and how to master each dimension to win the game and in real life.

Information on Moral Conflict 1941, a deluxe 20-sided dice version for sophisticated gamers, is also to be found on BoardGameGeek. Look out for information on BoardGameGeek for Moral Conflict 1939, an easy 6-sided dice version for play by most games enthusiasts.
118214.name: Moral Conflict 1940

118215.description:
Würfelwurst (aka "Dice-Sausage") combines two elements that have never previously been joined in the gaming cosmos: dice and sausages, with animals as an understandable intermediary.

Würfelwurst includes four white dice showing six animals and four black dice showing numbers and sausages. On a turn, a player rolls all dice, then sets aside one or more dice after each roll, then rolls again, then sets aside at least one die, etc.

What's your goal in all this rolling? You're trying to collect animals of one kind while having only high numbers on the black dice because at the end of your turn, the number of animals of one kind is multiplied by the lowest number on the black dice. The sausage counts as one, but with four sausages they count as seven! Each animal can be scored only once, and the player with the most points after six rounds wins. Do your wurst!
118215.name: Würfelwurst

118216.name: Stellar Wind:  Core Rules
118216.description:
from the Overview in the front of the book:

Welcome to Stellar Wind, a roleplaying game inspired by the Golden Age of science fiction. The Golden Age was a time when the future was viewed with optimism. Science and technology were seen as powerful tools that would greatly improve the human condition and mankind viewed the stars as its rightful heritage.

The book you have in your hands represents the core rules for Stellar Wind and is all you need to run a game or to participate in one.

In order to play a Stellar Wind game, all players should have the following:


A complete set of polyhedral dice.
A scientific calculator
Pencils with eraser
Copious amounts of scratch paper
An excess of imagination


Miniature figures may also be used if desired to keep track of character positions during play.

GMs and players will also need to know how to work exponents and take square roots on a scientific calculator.

118217.name: Predator: Concrete Jungle
118217.description:
Back of the Box

Banished to a remote planet for 100 years, the Predator returns to Earth in 2030, seeking to redeem itself for a century-old transgression. When the code of honour protecting the secrecy of an alien race was abandoned, strange and powerful technology fell into the hands of evil man. The Predator must now restore that honour through the complete destruction of those who violated it.

118218.name: DausendDodeDrolle (Issue 8 - 1996)
118218.description:
This issue conatains the adventure "Späte Rache" and the sceneario "Borkenkind"

Also conatains the map (A3) Prasnara and the fith part of the mystic races "Das Flußvolk"

118219.name: DausendDodeDrolle (Issue 9 - 1997)
118219.description:
This issue contains the adventure "Im Mond des Einhorns" and the part six of the mystic races "Moosweibchen und Waldväter"

Also a map (A3) of the "Kloster der himmlischen drei Klänge"

118220.name: Gabrielle's Ghostly Groove 3D
118220.description:
Back of the Box

Poor Gabrielle sneezed her soul right out of her body, and only the ghouls and ghosts of Monsterville can help! She'll need to bust out her best dance moves to get herself back into her body. It's a spooktacular rhythm adventure!

118221.name: CT Special Forces
118221.description:
User Summary

CT Special Forces is a run-and-gun for PlayStation and Game Boy Advance. Players take the role of a member of a counter-terrorism unit working to end the threat of terrorism. Players take on 12 missions of both ground and air combat. There are both single and multiplayer modes.

118222.name: DausendDodeDrolle (Issue 10 - 1998)
118222.description: This issue contains an adventure for Midgard 1880 "Der beschämte Zinnsoldat" and an Midgard adventure "Wink des Schicksals". Also contains the seventh part of the mystic races: "Sidhe"

118223.name: Pet Zombies
118223.description:
Back of the Box

There’s no better pet than an undead pet! Pet Zombies for Nintendo 3DS lets you reanimate your very own customizable zombies that you can play with, care for, or torment in a variety of environments where they shamble, shuffle and lurch. Bond with your zombie by providing it food, toys and interaction, but be careful; if you neglect your zombie, you may find yourself minus a finger, or...a brain!

A pet sim spoof with a horrific twist! Raise your own pet zombie, each with its own personality, by managing special diet, bodily maintenance, and morbid activities needed to keep it happily undead.

See cool, eye-popping, gory effects for things like thrown food, drinks, toys or brains with the stereoscopic 3D screen.
Play with your zombies in various mini-games like “Zombie Launch”, “Luck of the Dead”, “Dumpster Dive”, and others.
Choose to play nice with your zombies by petting them or torturing them with pokes, throwing toys at their bodies and even lighting them on fire!

Interact with your zombies in gruesome 3D locations like creepy cemeteries, evacuated malls and rundown military bases.
Customize your zombies with facial deformations, variable decay, clothing, and unlockable items.

Mix-and-match objects and themed backdrops to create your very own zombie environments that best fit your zombie’s personality and tastes.

Earn currency for use in the Pet Shop and unlockables by completing mini-game and gameplay challenges.

118224.name: Viecherei
118224.description:
Objective: build as many 'matching' animals with your puzzle pieces as possible
acting by turn
1 turn the puzzle pieces of 6 animals (total 24) upside down
2 roll the coloured die and pick a correspondent puzzle piece
3 try to form/build/complete an animal; only a completed one will deliver winning points - fantasy or real - both are accepted

118225.name: DausendDodeDrolle (Issue 11 - 1998)
118225.description: This issue contains the adventure "Das Geheimnis der Staubvögel" and short adventure "Dämonen-Glücksras" also rules additon skills for herbs and plants. The eigth part of mystic racea "Baumseelen"

118226.name: Emily the Strange: Strangerous
118226.description: Emily wakes up after a nightmare in which her cats were cat-napped! Now you must embark on an adventure with Emily to explore the many different worlds that await her. Use a sharp eye to find a way around obstacles and downright Strangerous smarts to solve the many puzzles spread throughout the universe of Emily the Strange! One by one, you and Emily will rescue her cats and use their special abilities to advance through this thoroughly Strange world. Emily the Strange: Strangerous features 6 chapters loaded with 65 puzzles and riddles that stretch over detailed settings like Emily’s home and 5 other distinct parallel universes. Earn rewards for solving puzzles quickly and efficiently and for really big achievements see awesome cutscenes where you get to know Emily and her beloved feline friends! For the DSi version of Emily the Strange: Strangerous, you can scan QR codes with the DS camera to unlock Zonster parts to create your own personal Zonster!

118227.name: DausendDodeDrolle (Issue 12 - 1999)
118227.description: This issue contains the second part for the herbs and plants skills. The adventure "Die Nacht des Tigers" and the nineth part of the mystic races: "Spriggans"

118228.name: DausendDodeDrolle (Issue 13 - 2000)
118228.description: This issue conatains the adventure "Eine schmackhafte Geschichte" and the second part of the cult description for the dragons of Midgard.

118229.name: DausendDodeDrolle (Issue 14 - 2001)
118229.description: This issue contains the adventure "Unter den Weißen Bergen" and the short adventure setting "Das Rasthaus Zur Güldenen Harfe".

118230.name: Psionics Companion
118230.description:
From Introduction:

This book is not a replacement for the Psionics Handbook! You
need to own or have a copy of the Psionics Handbook in order to utilize the information in this book. This book is a collection of play-tested alternate rules, more powers, prestige classes, psionic items, monsters and other goodies for your games. Advice on using this new material is also included, as well as advice on using the existing material from the Psionics Handbook with these new rules.

Special effort was given towards making the new rules and other information in this book compatible with other sources of psionics material. Even given this, many other sources should NOT be used. The most obvious of these are sources of other alternate rules, attempts to use the alternate rules in other products with those here will inevitably result in an unbalanced game. Other than this, do not use powers that are in the same “chain” as those that were removed from the power lists in this book. Prestige classes that advance in combat modes as a psychic warrior should be changed to grant one combat mode every four levels, while those that advance in combat modes as a psion should receive one combat mode every three levels. Other than these changes, individual GMs will need to make their own judgments.

For ease of use, this book is set in the same order and format as the original Psionics Handbook. It is hoped that this will make it easier for you to use in conjunction with that book.

118231.name: Seeds: Pulp II
118231.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Seeds and to this seventh product in the new line by Expeditious Retreat Press. Seeds are story ideas, plot ideas, creature ideas, adventure hooks, anything that can grow into an enjoyable gaming experience. Each seed is small (only a paragraph or two at most) and each Seed product will be small as well (only four to five pages), but just like their namesakes, they have great potential when provided with the right environment.

118232.name: Seeds: Pulp III
118232.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Seeds and to this 27th product in the line by Expeditious Retreat Press. Seeds are story ideas, plot ideas, creature ideas, adventure hooks, anything that can grow into an enjoyable gaming experience. Each seed is small (only a paragraph or two at most) and each Seed product will be small as well (only four to five pages), but just like their namesakes, they have great potential when provided with the right environment.

118233.name: Seeds: Pulp V
118233.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Seeds and to this 37th product in the line by Expeditious Retreat Press. Seeds are story ideas, plot ideas, creature ideas, adventure hooks, anything that can grow into an enjoyable gaming experience. Each seed is small (only a paragraph or two at most) and each Seed product will be small as well (only four to five pages), but just like their namesakes, they have great potential when provided with the right environment.

118234.name: Seeds: Pulp
118234.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Seeds and to this third product in the new line by Expeditious Retreat Press. Seeds are story ideas, plot ideas, creature ideas, adventure hooks, anything that can grow into an enjoyable gaming experience. Each seed is small (only a paragraph or two at most) and each Seed product will be small as well (only four to five pages), but just like their namesakes, they have great potential when provided with the right environment.

118235.name: Fallen Frontier
118235.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




The 2D side-scrolling shooter demoed at PAX East 2011 is the first game announced by Moonshot Games, which was formed in 2009 by former Bungie employees.

Source: Wikipedia, "Fallen Frontier", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

118236.name: Fantasy Life
videogamehonor: 2013 Japan Game Awards Game of the Year Winner
2015 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
118236.description:
Fantasy Life is an upcoming role-playing video game for the Nintendo 3DS that was previously being developed for the Nintendo DS.

Source: Wikipedia, "Fantasy Life", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

118237.name: Fez
videogamehonor: 2008 IGF Awards Excellence in Design Nominee
2008 IGF Awards Excellence In Visual Art Winner
2011 IndieCade Best Story/World Design of the Year Winner
2012 Golden Geek Best Indie Video Game Nominee
2012 Golden Geek Most Innovative Video Game Nominee
2012 IGF Awards Excellence In Audio Nominee
2012 IGF Awards Seumas McNally Grand Prize Winner
2012 IGF Awards Technical Excellence Nominee
2012 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Xbox Game of the Year Nominee
2012 Spike Best Downloadable Game of the Year Nominee
2012 Spike Best Independent Game of the Year Nominee
2013 British Academy Game Awards Best Innovation of the Year Nominee
2013 D.I.C.E. Downloadable Game of the Year Nominee
2013 Game Developers Choice Awards Best New IP of the Year Nominee
118237.description:
Fez won the "Excellence in Visual Art" award at the Independent Games Festival in 2008. The game was also nominated for the "Design Innovation" award.
Fez appeared at PAX Prime 2011 as one of the PAX 10.
Fez won "Best In Show" at IndieCade in 2011.
A demo of Fez was shown on 31 January, 2012 at the International Game Developers Association Montréal DemoNight.
Fez won the Grand Prize at IGF 2012.
Fez has also received many high review scores including IGN giving the game 9.5/10 and many other websites giving perfect scores.

Source: Wikipedia, "Fez," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

118238.name: Seeds Compilation: Supers I-V
118238.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Seeds Compilation: Supers I-V and to this 35th product in the Seeds line by Expeditious Retreat Press. Seeds are story ideas, plot ideas, creature ideas, adventure hooks, anything that can grow into an enjoyable gaming experience. Each seed is small (only a paragraph or two at most) and each Seed product will be small as well (only four to five pages), but just like their namesakes, they have great potential when provided with the right environment.

118239.name: Fire Emblem: Awakening
videogamehonor: 2013 Global Game Awards Best Handheld Game of the Year Nominee
2013 Golden Geek Best Mobile/Handheld Video Game Nominee
2013 Operation Rainfall Awards Best DLC/Expansion of the Year Nominee

118239.description:
Command your army and shape the course of history!

In the visually stunning world of the Fire Emblem Awakening game, you command and fight alongside an army of spirited heroes standing against an enemy with the power to destroy empires; a dark dragon whose agents include armies of the undead. Plan your attack, customize your forces, and guide your heroes as you forge alliances that strengthen your resolve in battle and shape the course of history. Lead a team of distinct characters with unique abilities, rich backstories, and evolving relationships that guide the path of your quest. Plan your attack carefully – the lives of your soldiers and the future of the world depends on it.

- IMMERSIVE STORY AND VISUALS:The deep and immersive fantasy storyline is told throughbeautiful 3D visuals and movies.

- DEEP CAST OF CHARACTERS: A massive selection of characters are at your command,withal with a unique personality and background story and different class types and skill sets.

- DOWNLOADABLE CONTENT: An extensive selection of downloadable content will be available for purchase and will offer opportunities to acquire new maps, new story elements, new playable characters, new classes, and rare items and weapons.

- CUSTOMIZATION: Create your own personalized character and fight alongside heroic characters on the battlefield.

- BONDS GROWN IN BATTLE: Team up characters to strengthen their friendships on the battlefield. The closer they grow, the better these friends and allies will fight together. Some characters can even get married!

- TEAM UP: Team up with your friend and fight against a group of enemies in the local multiplayer mode.

- The StreetPass™ featureallows you to exchange your team data. Recruit or battle against the other player’s team or purchase rare items they might carry.

- The SpotPass™ feature allows you to receive new maps, items and legacy characters to battle against in random battle and local multiplayermode.

To enjoy the 3D effect of Nintendo 3DS software, you must experience it from the system itself. All screenshots and videos on this website have been captured in 2D mode. Use Parental Controls to restrict 3D mode for children 6 and under.

Source: The Publisher Website.


Fire Emblem Awakening
Fire Emblem Awakening (Japanese: ファイアーエムブレム 覚醒 Hepburn: Faiā Emuburemu: Kakusei) is a tactical role-playing video game developed by Intelligent Systems and published by Nintendo for the Nintendo 3DS. It is the thirteenth game in the Fire Emblem series, and the second Nintendo developed 3DS title to utilize paid downloadable content. The game was released on April 19, 2012 in Japan, February 4, 2013 in North America and April 19, 2013 in Europe, available both at retail and digitally through Nintendo's eShop.

Gameplay
See also: Gameplay of Fire Emblem

The game is a turn based tactical role playing game, where the player must move their characters within a grid. The game involves moving characters into positions in order to attack the opposing side, or defend against their attacks. Characters possess a certain number of health points; when attacked, they are subtracted, and the character is defeated on losing them all. Battles are typically won by attacking the opposing side until all enemy characters have lost all of their health points.

Many new features, or features rarely present in the series, have been added to the game. The "Avatar" system, originating from Fire Emblem: Shin Monshō no Nazo: Hikari to Kage no Eiyū returns in greater detail, allowing the player to create and customize their own playable character.

In between battles, the player can explore the overworld map and converse with non-playable characters or buy items to be used in battles.

The game also features a class system, where different classes possess different skills, strengths, and weaknesses, with the player having the ability to change character's classes as seen in Fire Emblem: Shadow Dragon. Upon reaching a certain level, units can promote to a new class and the player can select between branching choices. There are over 40 classes available in the game. Characters can have up to five skills at one time, with surplus skills held in the character's skill bank. The game features a new option to perform a Dual Strike attack with a supporting character. Adjacent characters also have a chance of performing a Dual Guard, a defensive technique which cancels out an enemy's attack altogether.

Characters, while battling together, have the ability to develop emotional ties to one another. Some characters are even able to pair up and have children. The player-created avatar is able to pair up and marry any opposite gendered character, eventually having children which can be used in battle. More information about the characters can be found at List of Fire Emblem Awakening Characters.

The player has the choice of several difficulty levels, including "Normal", "Hard", and even harder modes "Lunatic" and "Lunatic+". Additionally, separate from the difficulty levels, there are "Classic" and "Casual" modes; "Classic" mode involves the permanent death feature the series is known for, where characters can never be revived after dying, while the "casual" mode allows characters to automatically revive post-battle.

Additionally, if two players interact with each other through StreetPass, their Avatar's party will appear both of their worlds. Players then can buy items from the party or recruit the leader either by paying or battling the team; battling increases the player's renown which is also shown to other players via StreetPass. A local multiplayer mode known as "Dual Tag" allows players to pair up to fight enemies to earn renown and items.

Source: Wikipedia, "Fire Emblem: Kakusei", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

118241.name: Skinwalker (d20 Version)
118241.description:
From Introduction:

Most citizens of Pinebox are excited that the Green Mark Corporation is moving in. The jobs are welcome and most folks are excited about the prospects. Among the few who are critical of the change, however, is one individual who takes personal umbrage at the news: the Skinwalker. He believes that parts of the forest are sacred and that Green Mark is encroaching upon that sanctity. The only way to restore order to nature is through an offering of blood — Green Mark blood.

This adventure is written for four fourth-level characters. Because combat is secondary to the unfolding mystery, game masters should find it easy to scale the adventure for any party. Refer to Appendix V: Experience and Mechanics for information on how to scale the adventure.

118242.name: Shufflin' Feet: Put Your Best Foot Forward
118242.description: Shufflin’ Feet is the funny game that takes unexpected twists on every turn! The players compete to win chips by playing higher valued cards than their opponents. On every round players place one card down in front of them and pick a player to roll the cube. The cube has three number sides and three action sides. If a number is rolled, players bet that number of chips, flip the card in front of him/her and the highest valued card wins the chips. Actions consist of trade, slide, and chip. Each action moves cards around the table to an opponent. If an action is rolled, complete the action and pass the cube to the next player. Play stops when a number is rolled. Quick wits and a little luck can leave any player in position to win on any turn. It depends on which direction the feet shuffle!

118243.name: Super-Powered D20 Rules for Heroes
118243.description:
From Introduction:

These rules enhance and replace the rule originally presented in The Foundation: A World in Black & White. You will need you 3rd Edition manuals to make the best use of these rules. Character creation uses the methods outlined in the PHB, substituting the material below in the process where appropriate. The world of "The Foundation" is one of the modern day, and thus you won't see many of the races normally seen in a fantasy game unless your DM says it's okay.

118244.name: The Immortal: Vampires
118244.description:
From publisher blurb:

For thousands of years the legend of the vampire has enthrawled and instilled fear in the hearts of men. The earliest legends span back perhaps as far as ancient Egypt, and arose independently in nearly every culture on Earth, from Africa to Europe, to Asia, the Americas and even Australia.

The Immortal: Vampires is a three-in-one rulebook, monster book and sourcebook for the d20 System. The book is jam packed with even more vampire goodies than before!

Dissatisfied with the generic vampire of the core rules? Too powerful? Too weak? Just not your idea of a vampire? The Immortal: Vampires puts a much needed spin on the classic bloodsucking monster, drawing from mythology and folklore around the world, and both classic and modern popular fiction. If the Immortal: Vampires doesn't have what you're looking for in a vampire, it certainly has the tools for you to create it yourself: Just about everyone has their idea of what a vampire should be, and knowing this, this book also includes a guideline to creating your own custom vampire templates.

Features

Details vampires for use as antagonists or protagonists.
Describes the mythology and history of the vampire from ancient times to modern.
Dozens of optional and variant rules for the core vampire and others, including feeding habits, rules for staking, and the effects of the blood of different creatures on the vampire.
Rules for creating your own custom vampire for those unsatisfied with the core rules or even those vampire varients presented in this book!
Over 30 new vampiric monsters and templates from both the folklore and mythology from around the world and inspired by popular fiction. From legend comes a host of undead from all around the globe from the Algul of the Middle East tothe Zmeu of eastern Europe. Literary vampires include the Nosferatu and Master Vampire, straight from the pages of Dracula, the Demonic vampire, influenced by shows and movies such as Buffy the Vampire Slayer and From Dusk Till Dawn, and the Romantic vampire is inspired by the works of Anne Rice.




In-depth look at each vampires method of creation, feeding habits, history, powers and weaknesses, going beyong the standard monster entry.

Rules for advancing vampires by Age Categories just like dragons!
The Walker Through Time prestige class, ideal for immortal spellcasters wishing to acquire evermore skill and knowledge.
Statistics for the classic 19th century vampire figures including Carmilla, Varney, Lord Ruthern and of course, Count Dracula!
4 completely new and original vampire gods for use in yor fantasy campaign, including full statistics!
Easily adaptable to d20 Modern, with conversion notes.

118245.name: Gensō Suikoden: The Woven Web of A Century
118245.description:
Genso Suikoden: Tsumugareshi Hyakunen no Toki (Gensō Suikoden: The Woven Web of A Century) is an upcoming role-playing game that is currently being developed by Konami for the PlayStation Portable.

Source: Wikipedia, "Genso Suikoden: Tsumugareshi Hyakunen no Toki", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

118246.name: Dice and Dramatics
rpgcategory: Non-Rankable Item (item will not show in the rankings)
118246.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dice and Dramatics is a general guide to improving your game through better role-playing. It is geared towards players and DMs of Fantasy d20 settings.

It discusses many issues, some simple, some obvious, while others obscure or easily overlooked. We've tried to make the guide as simple as possible without going overboard.

You won't find any complex new rules, feats or classes in this work, however, what you will find is a multitude of helpful hints and tips to help you develop your roleplaying. The guide covers such topics as avoiding meta-game thinking, thinking in your character's shoes, personality traits, creating a more detailed description of your character and background, and role-playing tips for non-human races.

There is also a section on equipment, magical items and spells that are designed to be interesting and practical more so than powerful.

Features

Tips for role-playing your character in-game, including how to avoid meta-thinking, how to think in your character's shoes, using voices, developing your character's personality and much more.
Considerations to make while creating a character, including advice on teaming up with your DM to create a character with intricate ties to her plots.
Advice for including props, voices, cut scenes, music and images in your game to stimulate your senses and enrich the feel of your campaign.
Tips on role-playing the senses fully.
Tips for role-playing non-human races, including the core fantasy races, such as elves, dwarves and halflings; the savage races, including bugbears, goblins, minotaurs, orcs and their kith and kin; and template races, from asimar and tieflings to lycanthropes and vampires.
A variety of new 'mundane' spells, equipment and magical items for more conventional every day use in a fantasy setting:
Equipment including several knives, armoured corsets for the ladies, and a variety of medieval clothing.
Magical devices aimed at improving every day life, such as Perfume of Personality, Broom of Cleaning, the Ice Box of Preservation and, every father's dream come true, Chauncy's Belt of Chastity (which will aim a specifically targeted magic missile at the offending organs of the would-be intruder!)
Spells such as Kalen's Fantastic Fat Burner to get rid of those extra pounds your character put on during the festive season, or Ease Birth to give those mothers to be a quick and painless birth.

Tips for role-playing characters from the other side of the DM screen.

118247.description:
5 vor 12 could be read as "five minutes to 12:00" (or more literally, "5 before 12") but in game terms the name is shorthand for the rules: The 5 must come before the 12 when those tiles lie in the grid.

In more detail, each player starts the game with a player board bearing a 4x4 grid and twenty tiles (numbered 1-20) for each player are mixed face down in their draw pile. To start the game, each player simultaneously draws one tile, then places it on one of the four spaces on the diagonal line running from upper-left to lower-right on her player board. Then each player draws a second tile and places it, then a third and fourth. Players then alternate turns. On a turn, a player must:


Reveal a face-down tile, then either place it legally on that player's grid or return it face-up to the center of the table, or
Take a face-up tile and place it legally on her grid.


Tiles in each row must increase in value from left to right; in each column, tiles must increase from top to bottom. When a player places a tile, she can place it in an empty space or replace a tile already in play, placing the removed tile face-up in the center of the table.

The first player to fill her grid legally wins. (In rare cases, no one will be able to fill her grid; in this case, the player with the fewest empty spaces wins.)

Contents:

Four 4x4 grids
Four sets of numbers from 1 to 20. Sets are yellow, green, blue, and purple.
Instructions
118247.name: Lucky Numbers

118249.name: SFX Skills: Diabolism
118249.description:
From publisher blurb:

How far will some men go for power? What depths will they plunge for the sake of knowledge?

Diabolism. We are drawn to its classical occult horror traditions: dark-robed cultists, blood-soaked ritual sacrifice, and the ornate trappings of dark magic. Like the fodder for any good fright film, it repulses and entrances us in equal measure. The Diabolist, the master of this infernal science, consorts with demonic beings and traffics in the worst of human depredations and suffering ... He is the most base of men, and yet the most modern: One driven by ambition and amoral self-interest to betray all that is human for influence and wealth.

SFX Skills: Diabolism is the first installment in the SFX Skills series, which details a new highly adaptable system of FX for modern (and fantasy) d20 role playing. Based within the feat and skill structures common to most d20 systems, SFX Skills are easily added to almost any game with a minimum of adjustments. SFX Skills also offer the ability to run both “high” and “low” magic games, even games consisting of elements of each, using the same system. SFX Skills: Diabolism is a self-contained toolkit for adding the dark magical tradition of Diabolism to your game, including rules for using SFX Skills, feats for controlling their access, and a new Background for scholars of occult lore.

SFX Skills: Diabolism was designed to be flexible and scalable for characters of 1st to 20th level, while maintaining a strong thematic focus that keeps Diabolism from becoming “just another magic system”. While particularly apropos for villainous NPCs, SFX Skills: Diabolism is relevant for heroic PCs and includes advice for “fighting fire with fire” and turning the Diabolist’s own dark skills to good ends.

118250.name: SFX Skills: Enochian Theurgy
118250.description:
From publisher blurb:

For every actions, there is an equal and opposite reaction!

Enochian Theurgy. The concepts of Black Magic are well known, through a variety of media, not so well known however are those practitioners of Magic that adopt a different Philosophy, that of Enochian Magic. Based on the summoning of Angelic spirits Enochian Theurgy is to Diabolism what Day is to Night.

SFX Skills: Enochian Theurgy is the second installment in the SFX Skills series, which details a new highly adaptable system of FX for modern (and fantasy) d20 role playing. Based within the feat and skill structures common to most d20 systems, SFX Skills are easily added to almost any game with a minimum of adjustments. SFX Skills also offer the ability to run both “high” and “low” magic games, even games consisting of elements of each, using the same system. SFX Skills: Enochian Theurgy is a self-contained toolkit for adding the angelic magical tradition of Enochian Theurgy to your game, including rules for using SFX Skills, feats for controlling their access, and a new Background for scholars of occult lore.

SFX Skills: Enochian Theurgy was designed to be flexible and scalable for characters of 1st to 20th level, while maintaining a strong thematic focus that keeps Enochian Theurgy from becoming “just another magic system”.

118251.name: SFX Skills: Hermetic Alchemy
118251.description:
From publisher blurb:

Its time for a change!

Hermetic Alchemy finds its codified origins,and its name, in the writings attributed to Hermes Trismegistus. The art of traditional, hermetic, alchemy is the act of transmutation - the changing one thing or substance into another. While most consider alchemy to be a secularist science or doctrine, entirely separate from faith or religious leanings, the greatest teachings of Hermes Trismegistus lead inexorably toward questions on the very nature of being and the transmutation of the human soul.

SFX Skills: Hermetic Alchemy is the third installment in the SFX Skills series, which details a new highly adaptable system of FX for modern (and fantasy) d20 role playing. Based within the feat and skill structures common to most d20 systems, SFX Skills are easily added to almost any game with a minimum of adjustments. SFX Skills also offer the ability to run both “high” and “low” magic games, even games consisting of elements of each, using the same system. SFX Skills: Hermetic Alchemy is a self-contained toolkit for adding the hermetic magical tradition of alchemy to your game, including rules for using SFX Skills, feats for controlling their access, and a new Background for scholars of occult lore.

SFX Skills: Hermetic Alchemy was designed to be flexible and scalable for characters of 1st to 20th level, while maintaining a strong thematic focus that keeps Hermetic Alchemy from becoming “just another magic system”.

118252.name: Grand Slam Tennis 2
118252.description:
Grand Slam Tennis 2 lets you play with or against 23 of some of the greatest legends from the past and present of tennis history. The roster includes both former and current ATP and WTA players.

Source: Wikipedia, "Grand Slam Tennis 2," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

118253.name: Guild01
118253.description:
The compilation contains four games, each designed by a different person: Liberation Maiden (Kaihō Shōjo), Rental Bukiya de Omasse, Air Porter, and Crimson Shroud.

Source: Wikipedia, "Guild01", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

118254.name: Halo 4
videogamehonor: 2011 Spike Most Anticipated Game Next Year Nominee
2012 Game Critics Best Action Game of the Year Winner
2012 Game Critics Best Console Game of the Year Nominee
2012 Game Critics Best of Show Nominee
2012 Game Critics Best Online Multiplayer of the Year Winner
2012 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Xbox Game of the Year Nominee
2012 Spike Best Graphics of the Year Winner
2012 Spike Best Multiplayer Game of the Year Nominee
2012 Spike Best Original Score of the Year Nominee
2012 Spike Best Shooter of the Year Nominee
2012 Spike Best Xbox Game of the Year Winner
2013 British Academy Game Awards Best Action Game of the Year Nominee
2013 British Academy Game Awards Best Art Direction of the Year Nominee
2013 British Academy Game Awards Best Audio of the Year Nominee
2013 British Academy Game Awards Best Multiplayer Game of the Year Nominee
2013 D.I.C.E. Action Game of the Year Nominee
2013 D.I.C.E. Best Art Direction of the Year Nominee
2013 D.I.C.E. Best Online Gameplay of the Year Nominee
2013 D.I.C.E. Best Visual Engineering of the Year Winner
2013 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Audio of the Year Nominee
2013 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Technology of the Year Nominee
2013 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Visual Arts of the Year Nominee
2013 Global Game Awards Best Shooter of the Year Nominee
118254.description:
Halo 4 marks the return of John-117 - the "Master Chief" - as a playable protagonist for the first time since 2007's Halo 3, as 2009's Halo 3: ODST and 2010's Halo: Reach focused on new characters and playing styles. Having been lost in space in the finale of Halo 3, John-117 and Cortana, adrift aboard the wreckage of the UNSC frigate Forward Unto Dawn, find themselves near a mysterious Forerunner planet, which was first seen at the end of Halo 3 once players beat the game on the highest difficulty setting. A key plot point will involve changes to Cortana and how her exposure to Halo and her operation beyond her natural lifespan may have contributed to her becoming "rampant."

Source: Wikipedia, "Halo 4", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

118255.name: Haunt
118255.description:
Haunt is played using the Kinect peripheral. Players use their body to control gameplay. One hand is used to control the on-screen flashlight, while other motions do things such as opening sarcophagi and doors. Emphasis on the player's entire body is used. For example, the player must cover their ears to avoid the loud scream of a banshee. Some sections of the game are automatically navigated, while in others players are free to roam the environment.

Source: Wikipedia, "Haunt (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

118256.name: Heroes of Ruin
118256.description:
The story of Heroes of Ruin follows four mercenaries who are attempting to find a cure for the ruler of the city of Nexus, who is dying from a curse. The heroes can either create an alliance or adventure separately. There are many strange and dangerous creatures in the land, including the evil force behind the curse, which the heroes eventually confront.

Source: Wikipedia, "Heroes of Ruin", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

118257.name: Pocket Shock-It
118257.description:
Pocket Shock-It is a travel version of Shocking Roulette and Lightning Reaction.

All players touch electrically conductive pads that will shock one player, determined according to the game. In Shocking Roulette, the victim is random. In Lightning Reaction, the victim is the last to press their button after the music stops playing.

118258.description:
Zebra-Schwein will have your children committing unspeakably horrible genetic experiments in the comfort and safety of their own home.

No, actually Zebra-Schwein only has children draw unspeakably horrible genetic experiments, specifically the combination of two animals as determined by a secret die roll. To set up the game, lay out the six animal tiles in a circle; each tile shows a die face next to the animal: zebra is 1, mouse is 2, etc.

On a turn, a player secretly rolls two dice in a cup, rerolling if necessary to get different results on each die. The player then starts to draw one animal that has features of both animals rolled, say, a zebeera or a pifrog. When any of the other players think they know what is being drawn, they grab the grunting plastic zebra-schwein and give their answer. If wrong, that player is out for the round; if correct, that player and the drawer each win an animal card. Then the next player clockwise starts a new round.

Whoever collects the most animal cards wins!
118258.name: Zebra-Schwein

118259.name: 0 A.D.
118259.description:
0 A.D. features the real-time strategy gameplay components of building a base, training an army, combat, and technology research. The game is about economic development and warfare. The game will include multiple units and buildings specific to each civilization as well as both land and naval units.

Source: Wikipedia, "0 A.D. (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

118260.name: Ribbit Hop
118260.description:
User Summary

Ribbit Hop is a simpe physics-based puzzle game for the iPhone. Players control Ribbit the frog and maneuver him to catch all the flies in each puzzle.

118261.name: Hybrid (2012)
118261.description:
Hybrid is a downloadable third-person shooter video game released on August 8, 2012 for Xbox Live Arcade. It was developed by Bellevue, Washington-based 5th Cell, the creative studio behind the Scribblenauts series, Drawn to Life series, and Lock's Quest. Utilizing the Source game engine from Valve Corporation, this is the first Xbox 360 title from developer 5th Cell.

Source: Wikipedia, "Hybrid (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

118262.name: The Dungeon of Galligron
118262.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the first in the Galligron Series of adventures. These adventures are designed to be truly modular. While they are all connected, each can be used separately; dropped into your home campaign with little trouble.

This first adventure is for 1st level characters, and may take them to 4th level by its completion.

The village of Sableford has a problem with goblins, and they have sent out a call for able bodied adventurers. The goblins are only the tip of the iceberg, however, as the adventurers soon discover.

This is a classic dungeon crawl that will challenge even the most experienced players.

118263.name: I Am Alive
118263.description:
One year after the Event, a worldwide cataclysmic event that wiped most of the human civilization, a man struggles for survival in a desolated city as he tries to reunite with his long lost wife and daughter.

Source: Wikipedia, "I Am Alive", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

118264.name: Det is Berlin
118264.description:
Objective:
Find matching combinations of hidden cards placed on the board collecting winning points (3 or 4)
- acting/moving by turn -
1 mix & place cards (pairs of buildings & sights/bears) upside down on free spaces of the circuit (board)
2 move your meeple (1 - 7 moving points)
3a ending on a card check it secretly and change places with another card
3b ending on a space with a bear move forward to next unoccupied bear space
4 at the end of your turn you may flip to adjacent cards:
5a if they show similar coloured markers (same building) you gain one winning point and the cards are removed
5b if there is a bear card next to your cards ==> gain an additional point

118265.name: Star Defense
118265.description:
"Defend 7 breathtaking worlds, each with its own distinct path layout, weapon choices and enemy types with their own specific immunities.

Incredible 3D worlds and breathtaking graphics - this is tower defense like you’ve never seen it before!

Build your defenses from 5 tower types, that's 15 different weapons each with unique attributes, firing ranges and reload frequencies."

Source: The Game Website.

118266.name: Inversion
118266.description:
Don't just defy gravity. Command it!

Take on the role of a young father and husband, Davis Russel, who finds himself thrust into war when his peaceful city is invaded by an unknown enemy. With his daughter missing and conventional weapons and tactics all but useless, this ordinary cop and his partner Leo Delgado will rise up to heed the call of duty, master the fundamental forces of gravity and save the world.

Source: The Developer Website.

118267.name: Sudoku Rush
118267.description:
User Summary

This is the traditional Sudoku game but with a twist. You need to solve the puzzle by pulling numbers and using power ups from a cascading waterfall.

118268.name: World Cruise Story
118268.description:
Build your own luxury cruise liner and travel the world!

Source: The Game Website.

118269.name: Super Cyclone
118269.description:
User Summary

Super Cyclone is a space-shooter game. You take the role of one of the best pilots and your job is to defend the stargates from the invading aliens. For this job you have a powerful rotating spaceship Cyclone. Stop the aliens if you can.

118270.name: 100 Dark Street and Alley Encounters
118270.description:
From Introduction:

Its now just past midnight and the adventurers are stumbling through the dark alleys and streets of the city slums. Who or what are they likely to encounter? Simply roll the percentile dice, consult the chart, and find out!

118271.name: 100 Trivial Bag and Pouch Contents
118271.description:
From Introduction:

Ever wondered what was in those pouches, purses, bags, and pockets other than coins and gems? Simply roll the percentile dice a few times and find out!

118272.name: Alternate Bloodlines, Vol. 1: Trolls
118272.description:
From Introduction:

While the common troll stock is the most easily recognized and understood, there are a great number of trolls with diverse, offshoot bloodlines. In the following pages of information we will take a glance at the physical and cultural diversities of these rather uncommon trolls.

118273.name: Monopolio Comercial: Conociendo Santiago
118273.description: This version of Monopoly set in Santiago, Chile uses local streets and commercial districts. It features attractive reproductions of bank notes from Banco de Chile.

118274.name: Cauldron Supplier’s Guidebook, Volume 1
118274.description:
From Introduction:

While the mysterious and often dark practices of the arcane is enough to keep the feeble minded and cowardly at bay a truly enterprising adventurer has a bold enough heart to journey into the darkened markets of foul mysticism, especially if the adventurer in question happens to know a bit about wizardry his self.

The Cauldron Supplier’s Guidebook is not an instruction regarding the arts of magical practice but rather a listing of commodities deemed valuable by those who engage in witches’ brews, alchemical formulas, potion craft, and experimental spell craft. Scattered across the following pages are the descriptions and listings for over two dozen items that may prove to be profitable for a supplier daring enough to deal in the ingredients of the arcane. A bit too spooky for the barbarian who shuns all forms of practiced magic, but extremely resourceful for the cunning individual who wishes to make a few extra coins off their dungeon crawling, forest wrecking, monster slaying expeditions.

118275.name: Cauldron Supplier’s Guidebook, Volume 2
118275.description:
From Introduction:

While the mysterious and often dark practices of the arcane is enough to keep the feeble minded and cowardly at bay a truly enterprising adventurer has a bold enough heart to journey into the darkened markets of foul mysticism, especially if the adventurer in question happens to know a bit about wizardry his self.

The Cauldron Supplier’s Guidebook is not an instruction regarding the arts of magical practice but rather a listing of commodities deemed valuable by those who engage in witches’ brews, alchemical formulas, potion craft, and experimental spell craft. Scattered across the following pages are the descriptions and listings for over two dozen items that may prove to be profitable for a supplier daring enough to deal in the ingredients of the arcane. A bit too spooky for the barbarian who shuns all forms of practiced magic, but extremely resourceful for the cunning individual who wishes to make a few extra coins off their dungeon crawling, forest wrecking, monster slaying expeditions.

118276.name: Cauldron Supplier’s Guidebook, Volume 3
118276.description:
From Introduction:

While the mysterious and often dark practices of the arcane is enough to keep the feeble minded and cowardly at bay a truly enterprising adventurer has a bold enough heart to journey into the darkened markets of foul mysticism, especially if the adventurer in question happens to know a bit about wizardry his self.

The Cauldron Supplier’s Guidebook is not an instruction regarding the arts of magical practice but rather a listing of commodities deemed valuable by those who engage in witches’ brews, alchemical formulas, potion craft, and experimental spell craft. Scattered across the following pages are the descriptions and listings for over two dozen items that may prove to be profitable for a supplier daring enough to deal in the ingredients of the arcane. A bit too spooky for the barbarian who shuns all forms of practiced magic, but extremely resourceful for the cunning individual who wishes to make a few extra coins off their dungeon crawling, forest wrecking, monster slaying expeditions.

118277.name: Cultic Fervor: Revcora
118277.description:
From Introduction:

The Queen Mother Of Prostitutes, Revcora is a lesser goddess with influences over sinful debauchery, shameless profit, and strife. A false bringer of “love”, Revcora tempts and destroys her followers and victims alike. By promising power and “a better way” to the poor, young women who willingly become the harlots of this goddess’s temple, Revcora is able to generate devotion through both her follower’s spirituality and trade alike.

118278.name: Distinctive Items Of Snobbery Vol. 1
118278.description:
From Introduction:

So the situation is rather a timeless classic… the adventurers have acquired more wealth than the combined riches of fifty kings, they’ve built their castles high, and now all they have to show for it is rooms full of coins and gems and drab, mundane furniture.

Release your wealthy characters from their simple clothes, boring furnishings, and dull, petty jewelry. Shower them with wonderful, unique items as you quickly drain their coffers dry. After all, once they’ve spent their last 35,000 gold pieces on a pair of garnet studded, dragon hide boots you’ll be having fun watching the characters sweat over the division of treasure again.

118279.name: Fantasy Commodities Volume 1
118279.description:
From Introduction:

While the wondrous, exotic treasures of wealth and the durable, weather worthy gear of adventurers are quickly provided in equipment lists, there is a whole realm of other items to be bought and sold otherwise. The fantasy marketplaces are full to overflowing with strange and bizarre delights, and perhaps the most intriguing of all are the commodities.

In this book one will find over a dozen different items of commodity, from goods that can be easily acquired by even the simplest and cowardly of locals to highly sought out commodities that demand the courage and skills of the mightiest of adventurers.

118280.name: Trodox (Issue 29 - 2004)
118280.description: Issue #29 with the main focus on DSA adventures in the south of Aventurien. Including two adventures

118281.name: Fantasy Commodities Volume 2
118281.description:
From Introduction:

While the wondrous, exotic treasures of wealth and the durable, weather worthy gear of adventurers are quickly provided in equipment lists, there is a whole realm of other items to be bought and sold otherwise. The fantasy marketplaces are full to overflowing with strange and bizarre delights, and perhaps the most intriguing of all are the commodities.

In this book one will find over a dozen different items of commodity, from goods that can be easily acquired by even the simplest and cowardly of locals to highly sought out commodities that demand the courage and skills of the mightiest of adventurers.

118282.name: Fantasy Commodities Volume 3
118282.description:
From Introduction:

While the wondrous, exotic treasures of wealth and the durable, weather worthy gear of adventurers are quickly provided in equipment lists, there is a whole realm of other items to be bought and sold otherwise. The fantasy marketplaces are full to overflowing with strange and bizarre delights, and perhaps the most intriguing of all are the commodities.

In this book one will find over a dozen different items of commodity, from goods that can be easily acquired by even the simplest and cowardly of locals to highly sought out commodities that demand the courage and skills of the mightiest of adventurers.

118283.name: Pirate Dice
118283.description:
Pirate Dice is an innovative, fast and funny little board game about pirate life. It is full of everyday events from usual pirate life: battles, horror gigantic krakens and old maps. In the game you choose the character to play. It's one of the famous pirate leaders. Each of them has his own ability to help you get rich quickly.

Turn begins with the player opens the top card in the event deck and everyone gets involved in a new adventure, which usually ends with a grandiose sea battles. For example, when the card Trade Fleet comes to play all players may send the quantity of their ships they want to rob that trade ship. In case the raid was successful all players divide the loot among themselves. When the card of Royal Fleet is opened all ships of all players have to take part in this battle. But they also have two alternatives: 1) they may try to escape: 2) or they may buy off those royal ships. There are also places where players may renew their ships. Floating Tavern is such card. The current player rolls a die and adds received number to the modification indicated on the card. This sum indicates the quantity of pirates in the floating tavern. These pirates are the cheapest in the game. They cost just one coin per pirate. After this the players start hidden auction to determine who will be the first in buying the pirates. For the hidden auction they use coins, it means who may buy more rum to the pirates. Most likely, not all players will be able to buy new pirates. The player who collects more victory points represented with gold and ships becomes the winner.

118284.name: Fantasy Commodities Volume 4
118284.description:
From Introduction:

While the wondrous, exotic treasures of wealth and the durable, weather worthy gear of adventurers are quickly provided in equipment lists, there is a whole realm of other items to be bought and sold otherwise. The fantasy marketplaces are full to overflowing with strange and bizarre delights, and perhaps the most intriguing of all are the commodities.

In this book one will find over a dozen different items of commodity, from goods that can be easily acquired by even the simplest and cowardly of locals to highly sought out commodities that demand the courage and skills of the mightiest of adventurers.

118285.name: Trodox (Issue 31 - 2005)
rpgissuearticle: Der Mord in der Rue Morgue
118285.description: This issue contains 2 adventure for Private Eye, Midgard 1880 and Cthulhu, also one adventure for DSA

118287.name: Fantasy Fungi
118287.description:
From Introduction:

While this book contains fantasy varieties of fungi and is by no means an accurate form of science guide, effort has been made to allow these forms of fungi to easily appear alongside normal varieties of mushrooms, molds, and similar forms in your fantasy campaign world.

118291.name: Trodox (Issue 32/33 -  2010)
118291.description: The double issue 32 & 33 is a special for Private Eye, so it include two connected big adventures with many background material. The campaign is also useable for Cthulhu 1890 and Midgard 1880.

118292.name: Malmö: spelet om din stad
118292.description:
The first game in a serie of Swedish cities.
"We Are Sailing" says that they with the game wanted to show the changes that the city of Malmö has gone through during the last 10-20 years.

The game is kind of monopoly with trivia questions about the city of Malmo.

118293.description:
Mondo Sapiens is a tile-laying puzzle game along the lines of Michael Schacht's Mondo, with players laying down tiles simultaneously in order to populate their worlds (i.e., individual player boards) with people, buildings and roads. the faster you go, the more points you'll score - assuming you placed everything correctly, of course.

Mondo Sapiens includes three levels of difficulty to allow inexperienced and advanced players to compete at roughly the same level.

Online Game
www.boardgames-online.net
(turn-based, at the designers' website)

Recommendations
Im Rampenlicht Nürnberg 2012

Home Page & Newsletter:


www.mondo-game.com


(german and english)
118293.name: Mondo Sapiens

118294.name: Distraction
118294.description: Strengthen your memory with Distraction! Players take turns drawing number cards and trying to remember a growing sequence of digits. Draw a Distraction card and you must answer a quirky question before reciting the numbers in order! Get caught repeating the sequence incorrectly and you collect the cards. The first player to run out of cards wins.

118296.name: Space Fleet Alpha
118296.description:
This game draws its inspiration from and aims to re-create the large scale space battles of Star Wars and Babylon 5. The premise for SPACE FLEET ALPHA is simple, to be the last man standing in a great big battle royale between a number of opposing starship fleets.

At the start of the game each player elects to represent one of the six available factions, each of which has a unique technological advantage and disadvantage and then is dealt a number of cards face up. Players then take turns using their cards to attack and destroy their opponents' cards until all other players have been eliminated. Depending on players play styles, the gameplay can be brutally fast and efficient with fleets of ships disappearing in the blink of an eye or slow and tense as players nip at each other's heels.

Cards are roughly divided into ship cards, which are the most numerous and the main targets of your opponent's fleet, and bonus cards which perform a variety of special abilities ranging from defensive shields, technological bonuses, reinforcements, espionage cards and thermonuclear warheads. The first thing to realize when playing SPACE FLEET ALPHA is that the playing field is definitely not level and no two games will ever play out the same. The random nature of the deal ensures that one player will always start out on top however, fortunes can quickly change requiring players to adapt their strategy accordingly. In order to deal with this, the game actively encourages the weaker players to ally against stronger opponents as well as use any leverage they might have to blackmail other players into doing their bidding for them.

Of course these temporary situations only last for so long as there can be only one winner and its this aspect of the game that makes it so exciting to play. While SPACE FLEET ALPHA can be played with 2 players, the game really starts to shine with a group of 4 or more players. Independantly designed and published, SPACE FLEET ALPHA can be ordered direct from the website of the publisher The Game Crafter which prints, produces and ships the game on demand. Overall SPACE FLEET ALPHA is definitely worth a look for anyone into space battles and looking for something on the lighter side that can be played by anyone.

118297.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Valar Morghulis, the first Chapter Pack in the "Beyond the Narrow Sea" cycle for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game, transports players to the massive and diverse Eastern continent of Essos with characters, locations, and events drawn from George R.R. Martin's A Feast for Crows and A Dance with Dragons. Players gain fantastic options for exciting new strategies, including versatile decks that start without agendas.

New locations reduce the "out of House" gold penalties for characters, making thematic Trait-based decks more viable than ever, and new River plots build upon each other to create interesting and increasingly powerful strategic options. Beginning a cycle intended to welcome new players while providing veterans with exciting challenges, Valar Morghulis is an excellent second purchase for players looking to expand upon the Core Set!
118297.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – Valar Morghulis
boardgameexpansion: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game
boardgamefamily: A Song of Ice and Fire

118298.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The SSU Battle Squad brings tough new soldiers to your Dust Tactics army. Trained in the art of rapid assaults, the SSU Battle Squad frequently forms the front line of SSU armies. This squad is equipped with a pair of DPM machine guns that allow them to pummel the enemy from afar.

SSU soldiers have fought on every type of terrain from the American Everglades to the frozen Russian tundra. With so much experience battling on hostile terrain, the forces of the SSU are among the most reliable in the world.
118298.name: Dust Tactics: SSU Battle Squad – "Frontoviki"

118299.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The SSU Close Combat Squad provides versatile new soldiers for your Dust Tactics army. After fighting in many intense close-quarter situations, the soldiers of the SSU have become experts at this type of combat.

Well-known for their ability to craft makeshift weapons like Molotov Cocktails, the SSU Close Combat Squads form a large part of the SSU forces. These grizzled squads carry Shotguns and a Flamethrower for maximum damage at close range, and to increase their effectiveness, they have learned how to scout out prime locations on the battlefield.
118299.name: Dust Tactics: SSU Close Combat Squad – "Fakyeli"

118300.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Swooping onto the battlefield to deliver reinforcements and perform quick attacks, the SSU Airborne Transport represents a large tactical advantage for the new SSU faction in Dust Tactics.

This is the first airborne unit in Dust Tactics, and it provides SSU commanders with a large amount of flexibility when coordinating their army. This expansion also includes an entire squad of Chinese Volunteers to back up the rest of your SSU forces. The SSU Airborne Transport is a must-have for any SSU player.
118300.name: Dust Tactics: SSU Airborne Transport – "MIL MI-45 / Chinese Volunteers"

118301.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The SSU Command Squad is an expansion for Dust Tactics. With this squad, you'll gain a new level of control over your forces, as this unit is indispensable in overseeing their comrades.

Use their skills to reactivate units that you've already used, bring previously destroyed vehicles back to the battlefield, or bring in squads to reinforce your army. With their powerful leadership abilities, the SSU Command Squad is invaluable to any SSU commander.
118301.name: Dust Tactics: SSU Command Squad – "The Medvedi"

118302.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The KV47 Walker is a versatile new walker for Dust Tactics! While the SSU once lagged in walker technology, they have since developed the KV47, a walker platform capable of trading blows with any opposing armor. This impressive machine can be fielded in three different variants: the Nadya, Natasha, or Natalya.

Whether you want to field the Nadya with its Sulfur Throwers, the Natasha and its 45mm Howitzers, or the Natalya featuring twin Circular Saws, there is a KV47 for any situation. Take command of this devastating SSU walker!
118302.name: Dust Tactics: KV47 Walker – "Nadya / Natalya / Natasha"

118303.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Operation "Zverograd" is a Dust Tactics campaign expansion that delivers new scenarios, rules, and background for the Sino-Soviet Union. Inside you'll discover rules for airborne units, a type of unit unseen to this point.

Additionally, Operation "Zverograd" includes the first SSU hero, top-agent Koshka Rudinova and her walker "Grand'ma". This hero is also the first in Dust Tactics to pilot a walker on the battlefield. Prepare to defend the doomed city of Zverograd in this campaign expansion.
118303.name: Dust Tactics: Operation "Zverograd"

118304.name: Stalingrad II
118304.description:
Published in S&T in from Volume 1, issue 3, through Volume 2, issue 1. The game materials content was a bit limited; you were given a list of the unit counters and a photograph of the map, which was a giant Stalingrad board with a few extra terrain features, especially in Finland. The limited assertions in 2.1 appear to imply that the game was played using the rules for Stalingrad, though references in Stalingrad III to Divisional Stalingrad imply that you could also use the Stalingrad III rules. Nonetheless, it really is a game, a bit under-presented like many other early games, such as Operation Gigantis (which eventually became Confrontation).

The theme is the German invasion of Russia in World War 2. The goals and game play could be identical (except for the new map and new list of counters) with either AH Stalingrad or Poultron Press Stalingrad III, depending on the optional rules choice made by the players, because the optional rules choice was to use one rules book or the other rules book.

If the game was played using the Stalingrad rules, the core rules were:

Stalingrad uses a move-combat sequence, alternating between players. There is limited advance (one square) or retreat (two squares) after combat. Units have one-square thick zones of control; movement directly from one square in the zone of control of a unit into an adjoining square of the zone of control of the same unit is not allowed. Functional terrain includes swamp (one square per turn movement), mountains (one square per turn movement, defenders are doubled), major cities (defenders doubled), rivers (defenders behind rivers are doubled if attacked only across the river), railroads (ten square movement bonus, must be taken all at once), lakes (impassible). Weather is good in summer, snow in winter, and governed by a table in the spring and fall. Mud halves ground movement. Snow halves ground and rail movement, and freezes (converts to clear terrain) some swamps, rivers, lakes, and oceans. Combat is mandatory between units that are adjacent at the end of each turn, but the attacker chooses which units attack which other units, so long as all adjacent units are in some battle. The classical Avalon Hill D6 table, with results such as D Elim, A Elim, etc is in use. Germans have limited replacements; Russian replacement rates escalate as the game goes on. The objective is to capture the opposition's key cities (for the Russians, Leningrad, Moscow, Stalingrad) or to destroy the other side's army. The Russian (implicit in rules) can also win by taking Helsinki, Warsaw, and Bucharest, and holding them for two complete turns.

Stalingrad was the first board war game with the modern placement of rivers down the middle of hexagons, rather than the old-fashioned placement of rivers on hex edges, as also seen in Stlingrad II.

118305.description:
Game Title: On belay – The Rock Climbing Game

Players: 1 or 2 players

Game Description: A game where 1 to 2 players start on the bottom of a rock face and take turns trying to make their way up to the top of the summit without falling off. Along the way your opponent and Mother Nature will try to sabotage your route and prevent you from making it to the top. As you climb you will be confronted with diverse weather conditions, faulty equipment, hazardous conditions, physical endurance, and a host of other factors, which will work against you and try to prevent you from making it to the summit.

Winning Conditions: The winner is the first player to make it to the summit.

The following are the [7] types of Weather Condition Cards and they’re affects:
1. Snowing – These conditions cause the climbers to become DISORIENTED due to falling snow.
2. Raining – These conditions may cause the climbers to SLIP while climbing due to rainfall.
3. Sunny & Clear Skies – These conditions have no negative affect on the climbers.
4. Night Climbing – These conditions cause the climbers to become DISORIENTED due to the darkness and will affect the SPEED of the climbers which will take twice as long.
5. Icy – These conditions may cause the climbers to SLIP due to the ice covered rocks.
6. Fog Cover – These conditions cause the climbers to become DISORIENTED due to low visibility from the fog.
7. Windy – These conditions cause the climbers to take twice as long and will affect the SPEED of the climbers due to the windy conditions.
118305.name: On Belay

118308.name: Moonfire
118308.description:
From Introduction:

Welcome to Moonfire, the first d20 System campaign booster from Thousandpress. Campaign boosters are designed to preserve the time, effort, and creative energy that many of you have invested in your campaigns. You have created many pages of location notes, detailed culture descriptions, timelines, hand drawn maps, curiously eccentric NPCs, and mysterious cults. No GM should give that up. Players too have treasured NPC relationships, great cliffhanger stories, and scores of treasures, wounds, and quirks that all depend on the campaign. They would like to play there forever. And yet something is not right. Favorite cities are a bit too familiar. All the royal heirs have been rescued at least once.
