Once dangerous wilderness has too often heard the pitter patter of PC feet. The last dragon they slew was the scourge of the land… where was the next one hiding all this time?

Enter Moonfire. Moonfire gives gamemasters a few unique twists on the implementation of their existing rules base. It also supplies a cosmological template that justifies the differences between your swords and sorcery campaign and the mundane world. Finally it has the capacity to change everything about how you play without destroying campaign continuity, burying you in new rules, or worst of all, forcing you to start from scratch. Just read on and add dice. The rest takes care of itself.

118309.name: 50 Cent Feats
118309.description:
From publisher blurb:

Looking for more ways to enhance your characters? The Le Games is here to help with 50 Cent Feats! Inside this fine PDF are 5 never-before-seen feats for you to use. These feats are:

Cross Strike [General] - Looking for a better way to use your two weapons?
Enhanced Save [General] - Your characters become better at making saves
Potent Spell [Metamagic] - Increase your magic ability
Quake [General] - Adjacent foes beware!
Withering Strike [General] - Time to pimp out your ranged combatant!

118310.name: 50 Cent Wizard Spells
118310.description:
From publisher blurb:

Perfect for your 3.5e campaign, we present 50 Cent Wizard Spells! This awesome book gives you five new spells to help trick out your Wizard to become something more. Written by the spectacular Brendan Davis, the Spells found in this book are:

1st Level Spell: Alistair’s Tearful Outburst
3rd Level Spell: Summon Experts
5th Level Spell: Helping Hands
7th Level Spell: Alistair’s Thunderous Applause
9th Level Spell: Bone Crush

118311.description:
Kaiju City is constantly plagued by giant rampaging monsters. For this reason, the city is always rebuilding itself in the hopes of fending off the latest giant monster attack. Will this be the end of Kaiju City or will the monsters be defeated? Pick a side and play against your friends to decide the fate of Kaiju City!

In Kaiju City 2-6 players divide into two teams. One team controls four titanic skyscraper-toppling monsters, the other directs the efforts of Kaiju City to defend itself and drive off its invaders.

The monster team stomps their way through the city destroying as much as they can as quickly as possible using special powers like poison breath and causing earthquakes. Destroy the city and the monsters win! This team provides a lighter gaming experience allowing monster players to focus on stomping their way to victory.

The City team draws and places tiles allowing them to manage resources and mobilize the military to engage and destroy the invaders. Kill four monsters and the City team wins! This team provides a more strategic gaming experience as the city players must choose their tile placement carefully as well as managing their resources to ensure that they have what they need to drive the monsters from their beloved Kaiju City.

Experience an asymmetrical game design and have several tons of fun crashing through buildings and zapping monsters with your lightning cannon!
118311.name: Kaiju City

118312.name: Moon Beans
118312.description:
The elderly wizard Zeljin zipped and zapped around the woods collecting ingredients for his dinner. Looking forward to his world-famous toadstool and cactus burgers, he returned at sunset to his treehouse hidden atop an ancient sturdysprout tree on the edge of Gnarlwood Forest. Removing his cloak, he discovered a hole in his bag of Magic Jelly Beans. Oh, no! they must be scattered all over the forest floor. Even worse, these were Moon Beans, which can only be seen by the light of the moon. Dangerous creatures come out at night in those woods and the old wizard can’t see in the dark. He needs you and your friends to find them and bring them back. He has promised a reward of fun treats and magic spells made with the mashed magic beans, but only if you can bring them back in the right combinations.

Players attempt to find matching pairs of jelly beans from a pool of face down tokens and collect amusement (victory) points.

When a player discovers unmatched pairs, he or she can collect recipe cards for amusement points instead. Players must also watch out for monsters hiding among the jelly bean tokens, waiting to steal their jellybeans.

This is a family fun game of matching and memory with a drop of strategy to help kids develop these lines of thinking and to keep the parents engaged as well.

118313.name: Child's Play
118313.description:
publisher blurb

On the night of the midwinter solstice, the longest night of the year, a kindly old toy maker gives out amazing magical toys to all the children of the village.

Need some new treasure to give to players? Want to add some background color to your village? Want a new setpiece that can be easily added to any world? Need a holiday to spice up your players’ time in town? Well, look no further - your friends here at Healing Fireball Publications are here with another book in our Curious Items line.Curious Items: Child’s Play offers a collection of toys both mundane and magical. These items can be used to spice up your world with some new and unusual magic items or simply to add color to the towns of your world.

But that’s not all - Curious Items: Child’s Play also offers a fully fleshed-out setpiece that can be easily slotted into any world. Child’s Play Toy Shop is a cheery little shop run by an enigmatic toy maker that often rewards good children. But that’s still not all - Curious Items: Child’s Play also outlines the traditions of the Midwinter Solstice Feast, a new holiday ready to be put in any world.

118314.name: Masks
118314.description:
publisher blurb

In a bustling theater district a colorful shop stands. Its plaster walls are decorated with the scenes of revelry that belie the truly womderul and powerful creations available inside.

Need some new treasure to give to players? Want to add some background color to your village? Want a new setpiece that can be easily added to any world? Well, look no further - your friends here at Healing Fireball Publications are here with another book in our Curious Items line. Curious Items: Masks offers a collection of masks both mundane and magical. This books includes 12 varities of mundane masks to be used to add some color to your world. Plus, a collection of 7 alchemical masks that run from the simple scent mask to the fantastic deep swimmer mask. And finally, a collection of 16 new and unusual magical masks designed to spice up your world.

But that's not all - Curious Items: Masks also offers a fully fleshed-out setpiece that can be easily slotted into any world. Eternal Revelry Costume Shop is a cheery little shop run by an energetic tailor with a shady side and a secret stock for those in the know. So check it out today and add a little mystery to your world tonight.

118315.description:
A murder has been committed in the Victorian steampunk city of St. Sebastian. You have made the short list of police suspects and the only way to retain your freedom is to prove that one of the others on the list is in fact the murderous culprit.

Players take turns making Accusations against the other players by placing Method, Motive, or Opportunity cards in front of them or providing Alibis against the Accusations made against them by other players. You must remember what has been played and craft your Accusations well to pin the murder on another player.

Ruse uses cards with specialized suits and amazing steampunk artwork to tell the story of murder and mayhem under the gaslights of St. Sebastian.

As a bonus, the deck may also be used to play all of your favorite traditional card games.
118315.name: Ruse

118316.name: Lutso
118316.description: In Lutso, the game is played on a wooden board with spaces for 36 marbles. Players receive wooden pieces in various shapes. On a turn, players place a marble in a random square. If a player places a marble that creates a pattern that matches one of their shaped pieces, they claim the pattern as their own by placing their wooden piece on the board. Whoever gets the most wooden pieces on the board wins the game.

118317.name: Deadworld
118317.description:
It is the age old question: what would you do if there was a zombie apocalypse? How would you find food? Or ammo? Where would you hole-up to protect you and your loved ones from the hungry dead? Could you survive with the people that you call your friends or would you be forced to leave them on the side of the road?

Welcome to Deadworld.

In Deadworld, you and your friends play yourselves by choosing the trait cards that best fit your true personas; this is done at the start of the game. After everyone makes their "game-self", players take turns searching the ruins of civilization for supplies, fighting off the growing legions of undead, building defenses and improvements to their home base, and doing their best to live with those they considered their peers before the world fell into chaos.

Be careful: the allure of anarchy and unbridled wickedness is powerful in Deadworld. You and your friends may choose to follow the path of good or you all may quickly descend along the road to evil. It's your choice. But that choice will affect how you interact with events and other survivors.

Ultimately, the goal of Deadworld is to survive. If all players can make it to the end of the chosen scenario, then the player with the highest survival points is the winner.

Can you survive a Deadworld?

118318.name: DausendDodeDrolle (Issue 15 - 2001)
118318.description: This issue contains an adventure for Midgard 1880 "Die Gretchenfrage" and an adventure for Midgard "Die Unheimliche vom Schandturm". It also contains a complete table for the leveling cost of the midgard 4th edition spells.

118319.name: Fingerlinge
118319.description:
Fingerlinge is a childrens game played with hair ties in different colors.

Firs, all players randomly draw 5 hair ties an put them over one of their hands (1 tie per finger).
Than 5 goal cards are revealed, showing a sequence of ties in different colors.

Players take turn by randomly drawing a tie and putting it over a finger.
As soon a p player has the sequece shown on a card on one of his fingers, he gets that card and a new on is revealed.

The first player to have 3 cards is the winner.

118320.name: Knot of Thorns
rpghonor: 2012 ENnie for Best Electronic Book - Nominee
118320.description:
from the publisher website

Way of the Wicked Book One: Knot of Thorns

The Kingdom of Talingarde is the most noble, virtuous, peaceful nation in the known world. This is the story of how you burned this insipid paradise to the ground. It’s only fair. They burned you first.

They condemned you for your wicked deeds. They branded you. They shipped you to the worst prison in the kingdom. In three days, you die. In three days, the do-gooders pray they’ll be rid of you.

They’ve given you three days. The fools, that’s more than you need to break out. And then, it will be their turn to face the fire.

Welcome to the first chapter of the "Way of the Wicked" adventure path! Inside you’ll find:

Knot of Thorns, an adventure compatible with The Pathfinder Roleplaying Game for 1st-level villains by Gary McBride

Full color art and maps by Michael Clarke
A gazetteer of brave, noble, doomed Talingarde
Advice for running a successful villainous campaign
Rules for creating wicked PCs

And More!

You’ve saved the world plenty.

Isn’t it time you walked the Way of the Wicked?

'Knot of Thorns' -- an adventure compatible with The Pathfinder Roleplaying Game for four or more dastardly villains of 1st-5th level.

118321.name: DausendDodeDrolle (Issue 16 - 2002)
118321.description: This issue contains the adventure: "Sein oder Nichtsein"

118322.name: DausendDodeDrolle (Issue 17 - 2003)
118322.description:
This issue contains 3 adventure designed for Midgard:

Das Geheimnis der lieblichen Meertänzerinnen
Mord hinter verschlossener Tür
Der Fall des Mondloses

118323.name: DausendDodeDrolle (Issue 18 - 2004)
118323.description: This issue contains background information of the city Parinov, the small adventure "Anoras Lied" and a big adventure "Dunkle Schwingen über Elhaddar"

118325.description:
In the world of RoboTroc, mad scientists compete to construct the most powerful robots possible out of salvaged spare parts. Naturally you wouldn't want to blow your cover by breaking environmental laws, so all of you will be scrounging for components in the junkyard.

To set up the game, shuffle the 45 cards and lay them out in a 9x5 grid; each player takes a character card. The first player takes a card from the perimeter of the grid, then lays her character card in its place. Each other player in turn order does the same, then play order reverses for the remainder of the collection phase, with players moving their character cards to adjacent spaces (which includes diagonals) to claim cards. Land on an empty space, and you get nothing – but are still active in the round. Once all the cards have been claimed, the round ends.

Players then have the ability to steal cards from opponents (or secure cards they need) based on the number of weapons they've collected. Each player can first secure four cards, though, so not everything is up for grabs. Players then assemble a robot with a head, body and legs, along with one weapon and any number of bonus cards. Each robot is worth the sum of its parts, along with any applicable bonuses; each additional robot a player can construct is worth ten points, no matter the value of its parts. The player with the highest score wins!
118325.name: RoboTroc

118326.description:
You have just set up as a wine merchant in the best wine-growing regions in South-West France. Your idea is to make the most of ancestral grape varieties, finding just the right blend to produce a wide range of truly outstanding and characterful wines!

Vignobles is a game of hand management and race to create the most successful vineyard and outsmarting your opponents by correctly using available actions and special cards.
118326.name: Vignobles

118327.name: Heldenhaft (Issue 10 - Oct 1993)
118327.description: This is the 10th issue of Heldenhaft.

118328.description: The other side is a queue management card game (Guillotine, Parade, etc.) where you try to get your chickens across the road in one piece! If you don't, they're roadkill. There are two decks of card, the action deck full of queue re-arrangers, Chicken killers, bonus points, and more. The chicken deck is full of chickens (imagine that!) Whoever has more of their own chickens safe at the end of the game, wins! The Other Side is full of humor and fun for most ages...
118328.name: The Other Side

118329.name: Future Pharma
118329.description:
From Introduction:

Future Pharma is a free publication offered in promotion of the Future Player's Companion: Tomorrows' Evolution, the third publication in the Future Player’s Companion PDF series from The Game Mechanics, Inc. It includes samples of drug related material found in Tomorrows’ Evolution, including the Pharmer advanced class, rules for defining pharmaceuticals in the d20 System, and feats involving designer drugs and sci-fi medicine, both the good and the bad.

118330.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The year is 1911. The earth holds only one unexplored place for man: the coldest place on earth. You are one of the five legendary arctic explorers racing to be the first to set foot on the South Pole.

By considering the terrain ahead in Roll to the South Pole, players must choose an optimal route and use their dice to take them farther into no-man's land. Will you know when to rest and when to keep pushing your luck? Will your route go straight south or through one of the depots? Can you properly manage your resources, or will you run short at the wrong time?

The race of high risks and careful planning is about to begin. Will you be the first player to the South Pole?

Reimplements:

Amundsen: Kappløpet til Sydpolen (According to the designer, the games share theme and graphics, but differ in game play, with Amundsen being a light game and Roll to the South Pole being a more strategic affair.)
118330.name: Roll to the South Pole

118332.name: Touch Hockey: FS5
118332.description:
"Touch Hockey is the premier air hockey game for the iPhone and iPod touch. Head-to-head match-ups bring frantic finger-flicking action wherever you go, or take on the computer for some extra practice. Wonderful for a quick game with friends or entertaining the kids, adjustable goal sizes balance the gameplay for everyone whether young, old, beginner or expert. Select from several match length options to fit your schedule and let the games begin!"

Source: The Game Website.

118333.name: TouchOff
118333.description:
"Are you quick on the withdraw? Do you have the fastest finger in town? Test your reflexes against up to 3 other players, or even pit your left hand against your right in this fast-moving contest. Faster than a speeding bullet, quicker than a runaway train, TouchOff is quicker than something that's really quite rapid, like um, a rabbit or maybe a greyhound."

Source: The Game Website.

118334.name: Wild Defense
118334.description:
User Summary

Wild Defense is a defense tower game. You need to defend your home against Evil "Ice Queen" who has possessed the forest animals. They will attack you by ground and air.

The game features

32 challenging levels .
15 different defense units.
3 different levels of weaponry for each soldier.
20 different types of enemy units including fearsome bosses.

118335.name: Windgeflüster (Issue 20 - Nov 1992)
118335.description: This is issue #20 with the main focus on horror and contains an adventure for Cthulhu "Zufallsbekanntschaft oder Das Tagebuch".

118336.description:
Paul Koenig’s Market Garden is a series of small-format, competitive introductory-level wargames covering the critical first three days of Operation Market-Garden, where the Allies attempted to seize a series of bridges in Holland and end WWII before Christmas. Each game in the series covers a separate bridge: Arnhem, Nijmegen, and Eindhoven.
As a player, you must command your German or Allied forces so as to capture key objectives on the board while keeping your casualties down (and your opponent’s casualties up).

Eindhoven Bridge is the second game in the Market Garden series, covering the events happening at this vital fiver crossing from September 17th-19th, 1944. Each player commands their German or American forces so as to capture key objectives on the board while keeping your casualties down (and your opponent’s casualties up).

With plenty of decision making and Optional Rules to extend gameplay and realism, the very collapse of Germany is at stake as you make your stand and bring your enemies down at Eindhoven Bridge!
118336.name: Paul Koenig's Market-Garden: Eindhoven Bridge

118337.description:
Game description from the publisher:

In Urbanization, the players follow the development of a rural area, from the beginning of the industrial revolution to modern times. They guide their villages through hard times and try to attract citizens by building houses. Later, factories are erected and the villages grow into prospering cities.

The player who develops his city most efficiently will be victorious in the end.

Game play in Urbanization includes no random elements, and the game comes packaged with an expansion, "the inventions".
118337.name: Urbanization
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast 003 – 10 Games for Essen 2015!

118338.name: SoulCalibur III: Arcade Edition
118338.description:
User Summary

SoulCalibur III: Arcade Edition was specifically designed by Namco for the arcades. There are some differences with home versions of the game. One of the game mode options is the Legends mode where you play as one of the characters and fight eight battles, earning points to upgrade your character. At the end of that mode, you are ranked according to what level your character reached. Unlike in many arcade games, in that particular mode, you advance regardless of whether you win or lose, which is a very unique feature. The other modes of play are the standard arcade mode and the mode where you try to locate special weapons, a defining feature of games in the series.

Unlike almost every other arcade game known to man, the arcade is actually a modified port of the PlayStation 2 version, which was released nearly six months prior to its arcade counterpart.

118339.description: In The Hunger Games: District 12 Strategy Game, set in the world created by Suzanne Collins in The Hunger Games, the players are citizens of District 12, using their wits to acquire food, clothing, medicine and fuel, while trying to avoid taking Tesserae and increasing their chances at being selected as a Tribute for the Hunger Games!
118339.name: The Hunger Games: District 12 Strategy Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 5 Controversy, Contention, and a Contest
Session Impressions: The Hunger Games: District 12

118340.description:
In The Hunger Games: Jabberjay Card Game, each player represents a District or Capitol citizen whose identity remains secret during most of the game. Players attempt to discover each other's identities and ultimately force their opponents to flee!

The game plays with 5-12 players, while also including a 2-4 player variant in which all players work together to protect the District Citizens from the Peacekeepers!
118340.name: The Hunger Games: Jabberjay Card Game

118341.name: Staves of Ascendance (3.5)
118341.description:
From publisher blurb:

The mightiest wizards, and many other heroic figures of legend, often carry a magical staff upon which to lean. More than mere canes or cudgels, they contain eldritch powers unleashed by the will and might of those who wield them.

Staves of Ascendance introduces magic staves and rods that grow in power as wielders advance in level, allowing you to put artifact-caliber tools in the hands of characters while maintaining balanced game play throughout a heroic campaign.

Staves of Ascendance includes:

Twelve new magic staves and rods, such as the Staff of Doors and Bramblethorn, the Arm of the Woods
Four new prestige classes that enable characters to tap into the special abilities of legendary staves and rods: the battlestaff scion, spellstaff scion, faithstaff scion, and swiftstaff scion
Guidelines for incorporating these mighty items into your own campaign

118342.description:
Skittykitts is a card game that uses a unique deck of 21 cards.
A Skittykitt is an enlightened space raccoon.

Game Play

Each character chooses a unique character:
The Princess - Always goes first; takes an extra turn after the Skittykitts round is played before the game ends.
The Wizard - Can add or subtract 5 points from his final score; once per game he can fire a "Magic Missle" to knock 1 card from any player's hand and into the boneyard instead of playing a card.
The Bat - Starts with an extra card; takes 2 cards per turn; takes turn after The Wizard but before the Fool.
The Fool - Always goes last and only starts with 1 card; always draws 2 cards at the end of his turn.

Each turn players can play ONE card (although The Bat has the superpower to play TWO, each character has special traits). You can also play as many cards as you want per turn if you control the card called Super Speed. Cards are played into different areas:
The Boneyard - This is a discard pile of sorts.
The Abyss - The 3 most powerful cards go here when played, they are essentially removed from the game.
The Zones - Each player has a zone, this is where you put stuff like Super Speed to enhance your powers and abilities, you can also use zone cards to hinder your opponents.

Every card has two sides. One side has the action/event and the other side can be played for points. Most cards are worth 4 points, although there are also the 0 point cards, and the 10 point cards. EVERY card was designed to be OVERLY powerful, which then re-balanced into them all being even, but still every turn a massive shift can happen.
The object of the game is to get the most points, but in Skittykitts even this can change. If the game ends with Reverse Gravity played in any zone lowest points win. And there are the dreaded 0 cards that can eliminate players entirely if they don't take care of them.




Components

21 card deck
4 special character cards
Detailed instruction manual
A pouch for portability
118342.name: Skittykitts

118343.name: A Question of Sport: Booster Pack Team 1
boardgamefamily: TV Series: A Question of Sport
118343.description: Booster Back for the "A Question of Sport" board game based on the popular UK BBC television TV-show. This contains more trivia questions to be used in the game.

118344.name: A Question of Sport: Booster Pack Team 2
boardgamefamily: TV Series: A Question of Sport
118344.description: Booster Back for the "A Question of Sport" board game based on the popular UK BBC television TV-show

118345.description:
A campaign expansion for Warhammer Fantasy Battles, 8th Edition, Blood in the Badlands details the conquest of the Badlands as multiple armies search for the legendary citadel, Fozzrik's Flying Fastness.

This 96-page hardcover includes new campaign rules, multiple scenarios (including several for team battles), siege rules and equipment, rules for battling underground, and new magic items and Cataclysm spells.
118345.name: Warhammer: Blood in the Badlands

118346.name: American Football
118346.description:
User Summary

American Football is a late '80s football game from Tecmo. Features head to head or cooperative play. Follows standard Football rules with fantasy teams.

118347.name: A Question of Sport: Famous Sporting Faces
boardgamefamily: TV Series: A Question of Sport
118347.description:
Set of cards for board game based on popular BBC TV-Show. This time with questions about famous athletes

Players roll the dice, answer the question and if it was correct move the number of spaces he rolled. Player who reaches finish first is the winner.

118348.name: A Question of Sport: Rugby
boardgamefamily: TV Series: A Question of Sport
118348.description:
Set of cards for board game based on popular BBC TV-Show. This time with questions about rugby.

Players roll the dice, answer the question and if it was correct move the number of spaces he rolled. Player who reaches finish first is the winner.

118349.description:
Set of cards for board game based on popular BBC TV-Show. This time with questions about soccer.

Players roll the dice, answer the question and if it was correct move the number of spaces he rolled. Player who reaches finish first is the winner.
118349.name: A Question of Sport: Soccer
boardgamefamily: TV Series: A Question of Sport

118350.name: Back Fire
118350.description:
User Summary

Back Fire is a shoot 'em up airplane scroller. The game features a side view horizontal scroller. Shoot endless enemies and destroy bosses. Hold down the fire button to create a more powerful shot.

118352.name: Karaoke Revolution: Glee – Volume 2
118352.description:
Hot off the heels of the original smash hit, the McKinley High GLEE club is back by popular demand with Karaoke Revolution: Glee - Volume 2, featuring an all-new set of GLEE's greatest hit songs and show moments from Season 1. Take center stage and continue your ultimate GLEE experience on Wii this Spring 2011!

Source: The Game Website.

118353.name: The Three Kingdoms
118353.description:
The game represents the Three Kingdom Era in Korea, around the 7th Century AD.

The game consists of three phases: power play and point calculation. Each player places cards on a three by three grid, then uses the results to gain either general, emperor, or cultural pieces to play on the map. Each of the key locations have a point value, and battles are fought if more than one player is on a location.

During the point calculation phase, the player uses the points from the map to increase general or culture points, determined by the type of piece that garnered those points. At the end of the game, the winner is the one with the most general points, but ignoring culture will subtract points from the total score.

118354.name: Karaoke Revolution: Glee – Volume 3
118354.description:
Get ready to 'gleek out' like never before with the McKinley High GLEE Club in Karaoke Revolution: Glee - Volume 3! The hit franchise returns with the largest lineup of all-new show hits and music performances to date. Karaoke Revolution: Glee - Volume 3 boasts up to 35 chart-topping tunes, filled with the show's main characters and show-stopping performances from Season 2! Put yourself at center stage and experience the GLEE phenomenon this Holiday 2011.

Source: The Game Website.

118355.name: Qin: The Tournament of Scarlet and White
118355.description:
publisher announcement

THE LEGEND CONTINUES!

Every year Governor Qi Xiang holds a tournament to which the mightiest warriors travel to compete, attracting merchants and artisans for the business the tournament brings. Take part in this tournament, prove your mettle, and uncover a bloody tale of intrigue and murder - if you can survive!

Welcome once more to the world of Qin, the fantasy roleplaying game set in the Warring States period of ancient China. The Tournament of Scarlet and White is the first of a series of short, PDF-based adventures designed to provide you, the Qin games master, with ready-to-use and inexpensive supplementary material to complement your Qin games. Along with the adventure, this supplement provides information on tournaments and rules for incorporating them in your game.

Designed to provide a party of beginning or relatively inexperienced adventures with a session or two of intrigue, combat, and adventure, The Tournament of Scarlet and White can be easily fitted into your existing campaign, or played as a one-off. Pre-generated characters are provided so you can get started right away.

118356.name: Kawasaki Jet Ski
118356.description:
Created under license by Kawasaki, Kawasaki Jet Ski offers entry to the exciting world of this high adrenaline water sport.

Featuring:

• Levels of playability that delivers an easy to use, but hard to master control system for the Wii. This allows both ease of movement and precision controls of the Jet Ski.

• A wide array of impressive tracks from famous location from around the world, including the Thames (London), Taiwanese Islands, Canadian Rockies and the canals of Venice.

• Multiple gameplay modes deliver vigorous challenges Championship mode, Time Trial, and of course the all out mayhem of the multiplayer mode.

• Additionally there is Stunt mode. Master a wide range of cool tricks available to the player while the Jet Ski is airborne. The Wii Remote to provides a sheer level of control that make a the stunt mode very addictive.

• The game also deliver impressive sounds, the roar of the engines, the sound of crashing metal as well as a number of ambient effects dictated by the environment.

Kawasaki Jet Ski is a perfect titles for the Wii. Not only does it deliver exciting gameplay, playability and challenges, but it also shows what the Wii hardware is capable of amazing huge, clean 3D worlds with mind-blowing effects.

Grab your wetsuit and open the throttle….Kawasaki Jet Ski is here!

Source: The Developer Website.

118357.name: Kawasaki Quad Bikes
118357.description:
Kawasaki Quad Bikes is the ultimate quad biking experience putting you in the driving seat of these awesome All Terrain Vehicles.

Featuring:

• A full range of officially licensed Kawasaki Quad Bikes, with unlockable extras, hidden quads, upgrades, courses and much more.

• Kawasaki Quad Bikes features the most exhilarating off road tracks known to man! This is a chance to experience the heart stopping power and agility of these awesome Kawasaki machines.

• Outstanding single player game modes include numerous championship and single race challenges, with over 70 track variations.

• Multiplayer mode allows you to compete against friends, with lots of challenging environments to explore, from gravel covered slopes to mud soaked arenas.

Feel the thrill of overtaking your opponents at high speed and catch crazy air to make the whole arena roar!

Source: The Developer Website.

118358.name: Kawasaki Snowmobiles
118358.description:
Skip across the tundra, power over freshly settled snow and feel the thrill of overtaking your opponents at high speed whilst pulling off some crazy stunts.

Kawasaki Snow Mobiles delivers a thrilling sensation of speed and snow!

Features:

• The most exhilarating arctic vehicles known to man and gives you the chance skip across the tundra, power over freshly settled snow and feel the thrill of overtaking your opponents at high speed whilst pulling off crazy stunts.

• Officially recreated under license, Snowmobiles offers a sheer level of playability that delivers an easy to use, but hard to master control system for the Wii. This allows both ease of movement and precision controls of the Jet Ski.

• Intuitive handling: tilt the Wii Remote forward to tuck yourself in, making your driver more aerodynamic and increasing speed at the expense of maneuverability. Turn the Wii remote to lean into the corners and keep yourself on track around tight bends.

• Kawasaki Snow Mobiles also features a stunt Mode which is a strong element of gameplay. It delivers vigorous challenges Championship mode or beat the clock in Time Trials and of course the all out mayhem of the multiplayer mode.

These are awesome machines in amazing environments. Climb aboard for the thrill of a lifetime.

Source: The Developer Website.

118359.name: Mail Order Mutants
118359.description:
Who will be the first to create the Rattle-Hoofed Eelbatross, the Pacific Duckguana Snail, or the dreaded Chipmunktopus?

Mail Order Mutants is a set-collecting card game in which 2-4 players assume the roles of mad scientists seeking to genetically engineer bizarre creatures to sell to rich, anonymous businessmen. The scientists scoop raw DNA out of a shared toxic sewer to create the mutants indicated on a series of order request cards, and then ship them to the businessmen's private menageries.

The scientist who is best able to scoop, splice, and slice the DNA in and around his gestation tanks to churn out the most valuable collection of mutants will win the game, and a retire a still-mad, but rich scientist.

Mail Order Mutants is a free print-and-play game, consisting of 103 cards.

118361.name: Dark, Evil and Macabre Items
118361.description:
publisher blurb

GM: You walk into the private study of the necromancer to see a horrid sight. Dismembered bodies on tables, jars filled with organs and old and dark tomes lining the shelves.

Player: That’s disgusting. I search the room.

So you have designed next week's dungeon, complete with a suitable villain at its heart. But what does that villain’s lair look like? Need some suitable creepy or macabre decorations for your mad scientist or necromancer’s private residence? Well never fear, Healing Fireball Publications is here with a collection of tables designed to allow a Game Master to generate a random group of dark, evil and macabre-themed items and decorations for your villain’s lair. All this for a mere 50¢

Product is 3 pages, plus cover.

118362.name: Feasts for all Occasions
118362.description:
publisher blurb

GM: In front of you is a long table set with a glorious feast. At the head of this table is Lord Bentele. He motions for you to have a seat.

Player: Oooo. What’s on the table?

GM: What? Why does that matter?

Player: I’m hungry and we have been eating trail rations for weeks. Now what’s on the table?

There is no better way to celebrate than with a grand feast. Whether held to honor conquering heroes, celebrate a holiday or honor a guest at court, feasts are part of the landscape of most role playing games. Unfortunately, the smells, sights and sounds of these grand occasions are all too often glanced over to get to the next crucial plot point. This is regrettable as eating is one of the few shared experiences to which almost every one can relate. A good description of a waiting meal can conjure memories of smells and tastes in the minds of players and can even be used to set the mood.

This product is designed to help create these vibrant feast images, with a whopping 16 tables dedicated to designing a well fleshed out feast. This product can design feasts suitable for any game situation. As a bonus, there are two small 10-option tables dedicated to giving the feast table and the feasting chamber some details. All this and its only 50¢.

Product is 9 pages, plus cover.

118363.name: Gems with a Unique Flair
118363.description:
publisher blurb

GM: You open the chest and find it full of gems and gold.

Player: I rifle through the treasure searching for any uniquely-shaped or odd gems.

GM: Ummm… There is a [flips through book]…. Ummm…..

Next to gold and magic items, gems are one of the most common forms of treasure to be given out in roleplaying games. Grand heists can revolve around gems and those strange alien components may be augmented gems. But how do you give these treasures a feel of their own and keep them from being stale and common? Well, your friends here at Healing Fireball Publications have the answer with a truly large collection of tables that will give every gem in your world a unique feel and style of its own.

This product is designed to create unique gems; from their shape to any defects or unique properties - they can all be generated. The real meat of the product is a set of four tables that allow the generation of 170 different types of gems and 10 types of pearl. All this and it’s only 50¢.

Product is 4 pages, plus cover.

118364.name: Gods and Goddesses for Every Need
118364.description:
pblisher blurb

GM: You open the large double door to see that the room beyond houses some kind of shrine. There are the rotting remains of offerings on the floor in frount of the statue of a beautiful woman.

Player: I search the room for any clues as to who this goddess might be.

It happens to every game master - the players are exploring a ruin and find a temple or are facing down a clut. Suddenly, you are in need of a new god or goddess for your world. Well, never fear - your friends here at Healing Fireball have just the thing to help solve your deific woes with our latest offering in our Two Bit Tables line. Within its pages you will find a collection of tables to allow you to quickly generate a variety of distinct gods and goddesses. From tables for the most powerful major gods to tables for the many minor and trivial godds - they are all here at your disposal. So never be lost for a suitable deity again, and it's only a mere $0.50.

118365.name: Kidz Sports: Basketball
118365.description:
Always wanted to be a Basketball Hero? With Kidz Sports Basketball, now you can!

Take control of your basketball team as you square off against your opponents in some of the maddest games of full-court 3-on-3 basketball ever!

Kidz Sports Basketball is a fun based sports game, which will have you standing up, moving around and literally re-enacting the movement of the game you’re playing.

Use your Wii Remote and Nunchuk to dribble your way past the competition and ‘slam dunk’ your way to victory.

Kidz Sports Basketball features a number of game modes including Knockout Cup and Tournament modes.

As well as the single player mode you can also go head to head with your friends in the multiplayer mode.

Impress your friends with your super skill moves by learning the special Wii Remote gestures. Learn to use steal shields, triple jumps and slam dunks to maximum effect!

The highly successful Kidz Sports range is designed to allow the player to intuitively understand the control system. This delivers an unprecedented “pick-up-and-play” gameplay experience.

Become a legend in your own living room!

Source: The Developer Website.

118366.name: Paintings for all Your Walls
118366.description:
publisher blurb

GM: You enter the large dining hall. A giant spread lays on the table in front of you and portraits of all kinds line the walls, giving a feel of opulence to the place.

Player: I examine the portraits; what do I see?

GM: They are a collection of various people of all ages.

Player: Yeah, but do any stand out to me?

GM: Ummmm...

Paintings - they decorate the walls of haunted houses, lavish estates and are often suggested as a good alternate form of treasure, instead of money. Unfortunately the details of pictures are often glossed over with a simple description relating to the item's value, such as its quality. However, giving these items a unique description can add to the atmosphere of a location or the perceived value of the item itself. For this reason, we at Healing Fireball Publications have created Two Bit Tables: Paintings For All Your Walls. This is a large 6 page collection of tables that will allow you to generate unique paintings to liven up your decor. All this and it's only 50¢.

118367.name: Plains and Savanna Animal Encounters
118367.description:
publisher blurb

GM: Before you stretch the lush fields of the central plains. A large herd of bison graze lazily in front of you and small creatures dart in and out of their feet.

Player: How large is the herd?

GM: Large enough that you can't see anything beyond it.

Player: All right guys - who wants to go on a scouting mission?

Vast stretches of fertile plains commonly populate the maps of many fantasy worlds. Farmers and towns dot these landscapes but they often feel like flat, empty spaces. To give these places more of a lively feel, your friends here at Healing Fireball Publications have created a collection of tables to add the missing grazing buffalo, stalking predators and small vermin back to these places. Two Bit Tables: Plains and Savanna Animal Encounters provides a group of tables containing more then 100 animals native to the plains, steppe or Savanna that can be added to those environments to add a little color to the plains of any world. This product includes 4 pages of tables, all for a mere 50¢.

118368.name: Portals of Every Shape and Size
118368.description:
publisher blurb

GM: The Mystic waves his hands and an oval vortex of energy opens in front of you.

Player: Well, here we go again.

GM: Hey! A little awe for the strange mystic please.
Player: Why, because he can open a portal? Big deal. I’ve seen it before.

Magic portals occur in most fantasy worlds, used as a method of quick transport, as a way to move large numbers of people or to open doors to other realms. Unfortunately, all too often these wonders of magic have a cookie-cutter appearance - oval-shaped openings of blue or purple energy. A portal’s appearance however could vary depending on who cast it, whether it’s permanent, where it’s located and where it goes. Well never fear - Healing Fireball Publications is here with a set of tables that will give all your portals a unique feel and appearance.

This product is designed to create unique magical portals, from permanent structures adorned with a variety of magical and mundane decorations to temporary energy vortexes used to make temporary passageways. These tables allow you to create portals with a wide variety of shapes colors and various effects and decorations. All this and it’s only 50¢.

118369.name: Simple Jewelry Items
118369.description:
publisher blurb

GM: In the large chest you find a small bag of gold coins, a shiny metal sword and a small polished, wooden jewelry box.

Player: Ooo - what’s in the small box?

Need a piece of jewelry to add to your treasure hoard? Have an NPC that always wears a certain piece of jewelry? Want to add something new to your treasure hoards? Want a quick description of a common magic item? Well, never fear - Healing Fireball Publications is here with our latest product Two Bit Tables: Simple Jewelry Items, a collection of tables designed to allow a Game Master to generate a random simple jewelry item. This product is designed to randomly generate the description of a simple jewelry item such as "A Copper Ring with a Topaz Setting" or "A Feather-Shaped Silver Brooch" from a list of over 100 items. All this for a mere 50¢.

Product is 2 pages, plus cover.

Now an even better value: This product has been updated to include four new tables containing even more items. These tables include hair items, clothing accessories, brooches/pins and interesting unusual items. All this and it still costs 50¢, so get yours today and dress up your treasure.

118370.name: Simple Treasure Items
118370.description:
publisher blurb

GM: You enter the opulent dining hall to see a stunning spread on the long table in front of you.

Player: Jackpot. I search the table for valuables.

Need some table setting treasure? Want something interesting to put in a chest as reward? Want a unique item for a heist? Want a quick description of a unique magic item? Well never fear, Healing Fireball Publications is here with a collection of tables designed to allow a Game Master to get a random collection of simple unique treasure items other than weapons, jewelry and money.

Product is 3 pages, plus cover.

118371.name: Statues of all Shapes
118371.description:
publisher blurb

GM: You enter the giant garden and see a maze of statues and flowerbeds. What do you do?

Player: I begin examining the statues.

GM: They are a collection of marble statues in various poses.

Player: Are there any that stick out as unusual?

GM: Ummmm.

Statues - they decorate town squares, stand in the halls of temples, libraries and courts. They often decorate dungeons and provide clues to ancient civilizations. Unfortunately, while statues are a common decoration, they are often glossed over with a simple description and little detail. However, giving these items a unique description can add to the atmosphere of a location. For this reason, we at Healing Fireball Publications have created Two Bit Tables: Statues of All Shapes. This is a large 6 page collection of tables that will allow you to generate unique statues to populate your world. All this and it's only 50¢.

118372.name: Tundra and Arctic Animal Encounters
118372.description:
publisher blurb

GM: As you exit the boat the cold air chills you to the bone and the arctic wastes stretch out to the horizon in front of you.

Player: What do we see in front of us?

GM: Vast tracts of ice leading to gently sloping snowy hills.

Player: Are there any animals or tracks.

GM: Hmmm....

The arctic is a cold, forbidding, desolate place, but there is still life to be found. Unfortunately, adventures that take place in arctic or tundra regions often feel like empty survival challenges until a monster attacks. Well, never fear -- your friends here at Healing Fireball Publications have created a collection of tables designed to add the colorful and unique animals back to theses cold regions. Two Bit Tables: Tundra and Arctic Animal Encounters contains tables with more than 150 animals suited to a tundra, arctic and Antarctic setting to add a little color to the cold places of any world. This product includes 4 pages of tables, all for a mere 50¢.

118373.name: Villainous Lairs and Location Names
118373.description:
publisher blurb

GM: You have tracked the fiend back to an island known as Savage Horn Island.

Player: Sounds like fun, I’m in.

A truly memorable, over-the-top master villain is the centerpiece of any good game, whether in a fantasy setting, action pulp game or a superhero world. But a memorable villain needs to come from somewhere suitably evil, or at least have a suitably evil-named impenetrable fortress. Not to mention all those great evil vehicles that they use. Well never fear, the answer to all your villainous lair and location questions are here. In this product you will find three Mix-and-Match tables designed to generate suitably villainous lair names and locations for all your villains, from the recurring bumbling villain to the lone mad scientist to the town supervillain team. All this for a mere 50¢.

Product is 2 pages, plus cover.

118374.name: Feasts for All Occasions - More Courses
118374.description:
publisher blurb

GM: The runner hands you the formal invitation to the baron's celebration.

Player: Does the invitation say what will be served?

GM: Why would that matter?

Player: I'm hungry and was wondering if I should stop by the pub first.

Eating is one of the few shared experiences that everyone can relate to. We do it to commemorate holidays, mark joyous occasions such as weddings or somber occasions such as deaths. Meals are often a vital part of personal relationships and business negotiations. So much of life's important moments are attached to food that the scent or sight of food often triggers memories and a longing for days past. And what better way to celebrate than with a lavish feast? Unfortunately feasts are often glanced over in game with little description of the meal, missing the chance to conjure these images that will make the scene memorable.

Never fear - your friends at Healing Fireball Publications are here to seize these missed opportunities with Two Bit Tables: Feasts For All Occasions - More Courses. This product presents a whopping 23 tables for designing that most extravagant of feasts, the formal full course meal. This product contains rules for making 7, 14, or 21 course meals. A special bonus section is also included for combining this product with last year's Two Bit Tables: Feasts for All Occasions expanding your options even further and creating a truly staggering number of unique feasts. All this and it's only 50¢.

118375.name: Gifts with Unique Style
118375.description:
publisher blurb

GM: You are led into the king's hall where he sits on a throne on an elevated dais at the far end.

Player: We walk forward, bow and present the gift offering of peace.

GM: How is the gift presented?

Player: Hmmmm...

Gifts - the word conjures images of brightly wrapped packages and eager anticipation on a recipient's face. In games, gifts are often presented to adventurers for their heroic deeds or presented by adventurers to nobles or as offerings to deities to gain favor. A poorly presented gift can reflect as badly on a group as a poorly chosen one. Unfortunately, a present's appearance is often glanced over. Never fear -- your friends here at Healing Fireball are here to help with a collection of tables to make each gift you deliver a memorable one.

This table presents tables for wrapping modern gifts, fantasy gifts and even sci-fi and steampunk gifts. Stuck for gift ideas? Then check out our free sister product, What to Give the Adventurer Who has Everything.

118376.name: Gifts with Unique Style
118376.description:
publisher blurb

GM: You are led into the king's hall where he sits on a throne on an elevated dais at the far end.

Player: We walk forward, bow and present the gift offering of peace.

GM: How is the gift presented?

Player: Hmmmm...

Gifts - the word conjures images of brightly wrapped packages and eager anticipation on a recipient's face. In games, gifts are often presented to adventurers for their heroic deeds or presented by adventurers to nobles or as offerings to deities to gain favor. A poorly presented gift can reflect as badly on a group as a poorly chosen one. Unfortunately, a present's appearance is often glanced over. Never fear -- your friends here at Healing Fireball are here to help with a collection of tables to make each gift you deliver a memorable one.

This table presents tables for wrapping modern gifts, fantasy gifts and even sci-fi and steampunk gifts. Stuck for gift ideas? Then check out our free sister product, What to Give the Adventurer Who has Everything.

118377.name: Kidz Sports: Crazy Golf
118377.description:
If you have never played golf, it is time to give it a try. The game is aimed to both adults and children – everyone will enjoy playing it. ‘Kidz Sports - Crazy Mini Golf’ gives to the player many hours of fun.

Grab a putter and hit the greens! The Kidz are back in their latest game, Kidz Sports Crazy Mini Golf.

Use the Wii Remote just like a real putter!
72 Crazy holes set over 4 wacky courses!
Take your putting skills to the next level.
Up to 4 players can play in various crazy game modes!

Introducing the ‘NuYu’ character editor. Have fun and a lot of laughs creating Kidz Sports versions of you and your friends to play in game.
‘Kidz Sports - Crazy Mini Golf’ already had the most accurate golf swing of any Wii title. Unlike other golf games which turn any flick of the Wii Remote into a swing, ‘Kidz Sports - Crazy Mini Golf’ feels like the real thing. Every subtle movement is detected and shown immediately on-screen, giving you accurate and constant feedback.”

Perfecting the use of the Wii Remote™ takes practice, and we all know how impatient some smaller family members are! So, we have also included a fast ‘Arcade Mode’ available for each individual character to ensure that the family stays playing together over and over again.

Play 72 crazy holes set over 4 wacky courses. Heaps of re-playable content with 18 hole or 9 hole, tournaments, challenge or single hole modes. Challenge the family or beat your best score. This is the biggest, best, most feature-packed and accurate Mini golf game ever - only available on the Wii.

‘Kidz Sports - Crazy Mini Golf’ contains Wii hi-res detailed graphics, animated levels, backgrounds, interactive objects, Real world Physics, fans, tubes and even floating whales. All the crazy fun you expect from a top Family friendly title.

About NuYu
DDI are also introducing the all new ‘NuYu’ character editor, (pronounced New-You). NUYU’s which is more detailed than Mii’s and can be brought to life in the game. Have fun and a lot of laughs creating customised Kidz Sports versions of you and your friends to play in-game. After specifying a gender for the NuYu, the user can alter the shape of the NuYu’s head, its eyes, hair, eyebrows, nose, and mouth. In addition, the creator can give the NuYu glasses or facial hair as he/she desires, or give the face wrinkles, makeup or rosey cheeks.

In multiplayer modes your opponents will also appear in game and can cheer or taunt your play on the green. NuYu characters can be saved and loaded into our future games, or saved to the Wii controller and taken to a friend’s house. Endorsed by world champion mini-golfer. Chris Harding - the current British Champion and 2007 World title holder. ‘Kidz Sports - Crazy Mini Golf’ Lots of challenges and lots of fun, once mastered, you will feel like a putting green King.

Features:

Single player and Multiplayer modes.
Player Customization.




Source: The Developer Website.

118378.name: Mundane Desert Animal Encounters
118378.description:
publisher blurb

GM: As you cross over the barrier peeks a large expanse of gold sand meets your gaze. You descend from the cold mountain peaks into sweltering heat and stinging sand.

Player: Do I see any movement?

GM: Warm winds move the sands, causing them to tumble down the sides of dunes.

Player: Any life we could follow to vegetation or water?

GM: Hmmmmm....

The word "desert" conjures images of a desolate empty place of wind swept dunes, stinging sands and strange rock formations. It is a common barrier that adventurers must pass in their journeys. However, unlike this desolate empty appearance the desert is actually home to a unique biome full of vibrant, colorful life. To add this unique feel of desert life to the world your friends here at Healing Fireball Publications have created this collection of tables to populate any desert.

Plus, included in this product is a bonus set of foliage tables to add plant life to your desert, as well as animals. All this and it's just 50¢. Product is three pages plus a cover.

118379.name: Mundane Jungle Animal Encounters
118379.description:
publisher blurb

GM: The Sherpas seem skittish as your party approaches the looming trees and dense underbrush of the outskirts of the Veridian Jungle.

Player: I notice the Sherpas and begin to scout out the edge of the jungle for signs of danger.

GM: The lush underbrush makes it hard to see very far into the jungle.

Player: Any movement in the trees or foliage? Can I spot any animals?

GM: Hmmm...

The word jungle conjures images of an exotic place of mystery where strange animals roam in the thick jungle foliage. It is a common location for adventure but unfortunately it is a location that often feels empty once the players get there. Well, never fear -- your friends here at Healing Fireball Publications have created a collection of tables to add life to these locations in any world.

118380.name: What to Give the Adventurer Who has Everything
118380.description:
publisher blurb

GM: I would love to get my Adventurers a gift for the holidays but what do you get the adventurer that has everything?

Healing Fireball: You get them something extravagant.

Just in time for the holidays comes a fun little collection of tables from your friends here at Healing Fireball Publications. This set of tables is designed to help the game master who wants to reward there players but doesn't know what to get a party that seems to have everything it will ever need. Simply choose the table that best suits the job of the player you want to reward or roll on the generic adventurer table and within seconds you will have a gift fit for your player. The best part of this little system is that it's absolutely free. Happy Holidays from Healing Fireball Publications and Keep rolling in the New Year.

Having trouble figuring out how to wrap that newly generated present check out our sister product Two Bit Tables: Gifts with Unique Style.

118381.name: Kidz Sports: Ice Hockey
118381.description:
It’s time to get your skates on! Join the Kidz Sports Crew in Kidz Sports Ice Hockey!

Kidz Sports Ice Hockey is a fun based sports game, which will have you standing up, moving around and literally re-enacting the movement of the game you’re playing.

Using your Wii Remote and Nunchuk, you can carve your way through the competition and ‘slap shot’ your way to victory.

Steer your team to triumph in the Knockout Cup, or enter Exhibition Mode to get straight into the action. The choice is yours!

As well as the single player mode you can also go head to head with your friends in the multiplayer mode.

Pull off some awesome super skill moves by utilising the special Wii Remote gestures. Learn chip shot, the power shot and the charge shot to send the puck blazing past the goalie and into the back of the net.

The highly successful Kidz Sports range is designed to allow the player to intuitively understand the control system. This delivers an unprecedented “pick-up-and-play” gameplay experience.

Face off with you opponents and deliver a devastating slapshot. Can you take control of the puck and take your team to the top of the league?

See if you have what it takes in Kidz Sports – Ice Hockey!

Source: The Developer Website.

118382.name: Kidz Sports: International Soccer
118382.description:
This is your chance to be the sporting hero you’ve always dreamed of! Take control of your team and battle against your opposition in some of the wackiest games of 11-a-side action ever!

Kidz Sports – International Football is a fun based sports game, which will have you standing up, moving around and literally re-enacting the movement of the game you’re playing.

Using your Wii Remote and Nunchuk, you can dribble your way through the competition, earn skill points and pull off crazy super moves to really defeat your opponents in style!

Steer your team to triumph in the Knockout Cup, or enter Exhibition Mode to get straight into the action. The choice is yours!

The highly successful Kidz Sports range is designed to allow the player to intuitively understand the control system. This delivers an unprecedented “pick-up-and-play” gameplay experience.

Have you got the skills to take your team to the top of the league? Will you be lifting the trophies? See if you have what it takes in Kidz Sports - International Football.

Source: The Developer Website.

118383.name: Strange, Dead Love
rpgpublisher: CCP Games / CCP hf (Crowd Control Productions)
118383.description:
publisher blurb

"No God commands me, yet I answer to a higher law than yours. My heart does not beat, yet it still feels. Only her word rules me, and only her smile warms my blood."
- J. Carlton, Nosferatu Harpy of Baltimore

This book includes:
- A guide to the themes and props of paranormal romance, custom-fitted for Vampire: The Requiem.
- A collection of world shards, ready-made chronicles with their own plot hooks and rules.
- Advice for storytelling romance, including guidance on games for two.

118384.name: Imperial Mysteries
118384.description:
publisher blurb

"Imagine Awakening again. Imagine walking in a universe of dust, feeling it shape to your desire and retreat from your wrath. Imagine knowing that everyone and everything you ever cared about can be changed, forever, by your actions, the actions of your peers and those of your rivals. Imagine the fear, the crushing responsibility and the intoxicating, addictive power.

Would you trust anyone with this? Would you trust yourself, Heirarch?"

- Aaliyah, Bodhissatva

A supplement for Mage: the Awakening

- Full Rules for archmasters, including the Practices of the sixth to ninth Arcana dots.

- Details of the Threshold, the trials that await a mage attempting to become an Archmage.

- Information on the World of Darkness as seen by archmasters; the Ascension War between rival visions for the Fallen World, the alliances Archmages form to promote those visions, the strange realms they explore and the godlike entities they encounter.

- Exploration of the Supernal Realms and the nature of Ascension.

- A minigame portraying Archmages in the Supernal.

- Storyteller advice for chronicles of cosmic scope.

118385.description:
The ancient armies of Macedonia and Persia are yours to command in Pocket Battles: Macedonians vs. Persians, a tile-based war game. You'll fight on three fronts with armies you create for each battle, making every battle a new experience.

Each Pocket Battles game depicts two armies. The rules for combat are the same in each Pocket Battles game so you can have armies from different series fighting: Elves vs. Romans! WW2 soldiers vs. Napoleonic forces! It's all possible with Pocket Battles.

The basic rules of the game are simple; two armies face each other in battle. The armies are split into three columns and two rows. Players must decide, at the start of the game, how many points they will give to their armies, determining how many points it will take to defeat the opponents army. (At least half of the points).

On you turn; you have to choose which faction of your army you will send off to battle! Attacks are made by using Order Tokens. If no Order Tokens are present on a unit, it costs just 1 token to issue orders to that unit. Issuing orders to the same unit in the same Battle Round would cost you the number of tokens present on the unit, plus 1. (So if there is one token on you unit, it would cost you two more tokens; if you had three, it would cost you four tokens, and so on).

After a round of battle, you may choose to redeploy you units. (Units may move from the back row to the front row, from the back of a row to the back of another row, or from the front of a row to the front of another row). Redeployment will not cost you any Order tokens.

The battle is over when one army defeats the other.

Contents:
60 tiles, 6 dice, 20 wound/order tokens, 2 player aids, 1 set of rules.

Macedonians: 1 agema, 2 agriganes, 1 alexandros, 1 argyraspides, 1 chiliarch, 5 cretan archers, 4 hetairoi, 4 hypaspistai, 4 peltasts, 4 pezhetairoi, 2 prodromoi and 1 standard bearer.

Persians: 6 archers, 1 baivarapatis, 1 chariot, 1 darius, 2 elephants, 3 immortals, 3 kardaka, 3 levies, 3 median calary, 1 scyted chariot, 2 sparabara, 1 standard bearer and 3 takabara.
118385.name: Pocket Battles: Macedonians vs. Persians

118386.name: Small Worlds
118386.description:
User Summary

The game is subtitled "A short atmospheric game about exploring." Navigate a number of "worlds" and find the exit in each. Each world can be thought of as telling a story.

118387.name: DausendDodeDrolle (Issue 19 - 2009)
118387.description: This issue contains the adventure "Das Rauschen der Wildgänse" and some articles about traps.

118388.name: DausendDodeDrolle (Issue 20 - Nov 2009)
118388.description: This issue contains the adventure "Ritter und Räuber" and articles about the magic in Mindgard.

118389.name: Elexikon 2020
118389.description:
An electronic dictionary quiz game with questions and answers about nature, technology, etc.
Players answer the questions with an electronic pen, which flashes green if the answer is correct.
Whoever has the most correct answers at the end of the game is the winner.

118390.name: Elexikon 1150
118390.description:
An electronic dictionary quiz game with questions and answers about animals and nature.
Players answer the questions with electronic pen what flashes green if the answer is correct.
Who has more correct answers at the end of the game is the winner.

118391.name: Mouse Elexikon
118391.description:
Elexikon variant for kids.
An electronic dictionary quiz game with over 1100 questions and answers with images for 1 or more players.
Players answer the questions with electronic mouse instead of pen. Mouse eye flashes green if the answer is correct.
Who has more correct answers at the end of the game is the winner.

118392.name: Elexikon Langenscheidt Englisch
118392.description:
An electronic dictionary quiz game with questions and answers for learning English.
Players answer the questions with electronic pen what flashes green if the answer is correct.
Who has more correct answers at the end of the game is the winner.

118393.name: Junior Elexikon
118393.description:
An electronic dictionary quiz game for younger players.
Players answer the questions with electronic pen what flashes green if the answer is correct.
Who has more correct answers at the end of the game is the winner.

118394.name: Elexikon 1440
118394.description:
An electronic dictionary quiz game with questions and answers about nature, technology etc.
Players answer the questions with electronic pen what flashes green if the answer is correct.
Who has more correct answers at the end of the game is the winner.

118395.name: Elexikon
118395.description:
An electronic dictionary quiz game with over 1100 questions and answers with images for one or more players.
Players answer the questions with an electronic pen which flashes green if the answer is correct.
Whoever has the most correct answers at the end of the game is the winner.

118396.name: Elexikon Ergänzungsmappe 4
118396.description:
Some new boards with 12 new themes for the Elexikon game that replace the board from the base game.
Some new themes with new questions are:
"In the Film Studio", "Protected animals" etc.

118397.name: Elexikon Ergänzungsmappe 5
118397.description:
Some new boards with 12 new themes for the Elexikon game that replace the board from the base game.
Some new themes with new questions are:
"Proverbial sayings" etc.

118398.name: Elexikon Ergänzungsmappe 6
118398.description:
Some new boards with 12 new themes for the Elexikon game that replace the board from the base game.
Some new themes with new questions are:
"The human eye" etc.

118399.name: Elexikon Ergänzungsmappe 3
118399.description:
Some new boards with 12 new themes for the Elexikon game that replace the board from the base game.
Some new themes with new questions are:
"famous physician" etc.

118400.name: Elexikon Ergänzungsmappe 2
118400.description:
Some new boards with 12 new themes for the Elexikon game that replace the board from the base game.
Some new themes with new questions are:
"In the hospital", "our car", etc.

118401.name: Elexikon Ergänzungsmappe 1
118401.description:
Some new boards with 12 new themes for the Elexikon game that replace the board from the base game.
Some new themes with new questions are:
"On the farm" etc.

boardgamehonor: 2013 Golden Geek Best Abstract Board Game Nominee
118402.description:
Game description from the publisher:

In Maharani, the players are architects helping the King to complete the Taj Mahal palace by placing beautiful mosaic tiles. These tiles come into play through a rotating rondel, which enables every player to place the tiles in different parts of the palace. Once the mosaic is complete, the best architect wins the game.
118402.name: Maharani
boardgamepodcastepisode: Garrett's Games 328 - K2, Indigo, and Maharani

118403.name: DausendDodeDrolle (Issue 21 - Feb 2010)
118403.description: This issue contains the adventure "Wenn Tote wandeln" and a new character class "Der Trankkundige"

118404.name: DausendDodeDrolle (Issue 22 - Oct 2010)
118404.description: This issue contains the adventure "Der Reif der Nebthut"

118405.name: Gildenbrief (Issue 24 - Dec 1991)
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
118405.description: This issue has its main focus on magic and including 35 new magic spells.

118406.name: Gildenbrief (Issue 25 - Jul 1992)
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
118406.description:
This issue has articles about horses and some cults at Midgard.
It alos contains one new spell.

118407.name: Gildenbrief (Issue 26- Nov 1992)
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
118407.description: witches, banes, magical artifacts and news spells are main part of the articles in this issue. It also contains a new creature "Das Phantom"

118408.name: Fodboldspillet Onside
118408.description:
Sportsgame, football (soccer)

Play a season in the Danish Superliga (known as Faxekondi Ligaen, when the game was released).

Goal of the game: To finish as #1 in the league.

Through comparing dice rolls with stats on the fielded football-players, the gameplayers move the players up and down the gameboard (football field) and hopefully score goals (just like a real football match).

In the off-season gameplayers can transfer their players and buy better players for their team.

boardgameimplementation: Der Landvogt und die fraechen Luegner
118410.description:
Only a dirty pig is a happy pig!

In Drecksau, each player has 3-5 clean pigs in front of him and three cards in hand. Each turn one card is played. By playing a mud card, one pig can be sent into the mud. The pig card is flipped over to show a dirty pig on the back. Rain cards clean all pigs, even your own! Barn cards protect pigs from the rain, while lightning cards destroy barns – but lightning rod cards protect barns from lightning cards. Farmer cards can be sent to dirty pigs: the farmer likes clean pigs... Pigs in a barn that are protected with a lock card are safe from the farmer. The first player who has dirtied all of his pigs wins!
118410.name: Drecksau
boardgamepodcastepisode: Garrett's Games 357 - SdJ Speculation, Drecksau, Bora Bora, and Guildhall

118413.name: Fire Powers
118413.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

FIRE! Maybe not something to shout in a crowded theater, but a major source of super-powers. In the inaugural entry in our new Power Profiles series, we spark things off with a look at real "Fire Power," from hurling blasts of flame to fiery auras, rocket-powered flight, transforming into a being of fire or summoning them to do your bidding.

118414.name: word MAX
118414.description:
"Makes Literacy a Game"
A word game designed to be played in English, French, Italian and Spanish concurrently. Players choose to play individual games in 1, 2, 3 or all 4 of the languages. There are 3 Play Variations: Word Play, Sentence Play, or Theme Play.
In Word Play: Players randomly select 8 letter tiles from the bag. A player spells a word using all/some of their tiles, and takes coloured tokens corresponding to their point score. Players can also Borrow words previously played to create another word by Adding, Subtracting, Replacing, or Rearranging the tiles and so earn more tokens.
The game ends when there are no more tiles in the bag and one of the players uses up all their tiles. The winner is the one with the highest value of tokens.
Sentence Play requires words played in a meaningful sentence.
Theme Play requires the words are used in a sentence in the context of a chosen theme (e.g., environment, fairy tales, countries, etc)
Can be played competitively or cooperatively.

118415.name: QWR
118415.description:
"A Game of Quick Wit & Repartee"
There are 2 sections: Objectives and Performance.
The Objectives section is divided into 3 areas. The player must correctly answer a multiple-choice question from the area in which they land. They move forward one space for every correct answer. A player's turn ends when they answer incorrectly, or when they move out of the Objectives area.
The Performance section is divided into 3 areas. The player must perform one of the 3 area-actions: Connections, Puns, or Retorts.
Connections - player is given 5 topics in 15 second intervals and must speak for 15 seconds on each topic, connecting it to the one before.
Puns - player has 15 seconds to respond to a pun read out by another player.
Retorts - player must respond to an insult read out by another player.
In the Performance section the player's performance is voted on by the other players [1,2,3] and their marker moves forward on the board the average of the sum.
To win, the player arrives at the centre of the board, the 2nd place player picks an Objective card and reads out from one of the 3 multiple-choice questions. If the player answers correctly they win. If incorrect, they move back one square and the game continues. Note: if the player is making a second attempt at winning by answering the question, and fails, they move back 2 spaces, etc.

118416.name: Silent Scope Complete
118416.description:
Silent Scope Complete is the final installment of the Silent Scope video game series developed by Konami. Released on February 10, 2004 for the Xbox game console, it brings together the three previous Silent Scope games while adding additional levels, story branches, and features. The player is a professional, government-supported sniper charged with foiling different terrorist attacks. Traveling between various locations, the player eliminates his adversaries with a high-power sniper rifle. Rewards are given for accuracy and speed, while players are punished for killing civilians or failing to complete a mission within the alloted time.

Source: Wikipedia, "Silent Scope Complete", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

118417.name: Windgeflüster (Issue 21 - Apr 1993)
rpgissuearticle: Die Beudeutung Mittelerdes für das Rollenspiel
Vorwort: Wir wollen nicht länger schweigen!
118417.description: This issue contains NSCs for fantasy RPGs, also an article about celtic myth. Of course news and reviews of new RPG stuff.

boardgamehonor: 2013 Boardgames Australia Awards Best International Game Nominee
2013 Spiel des Jahres Game of the Year Recommended
118418.description:
London, November 17th, 1896: The streets of the city are almost deserted, traveled only by passersby whose only goal seems to reach their warm homes as quickly as possible. But in the private salons of a luxury Bloomsbury hotel, the goal is something completely different. The fifty greatest known mediums are taking part in a never-before-seen tournament in order to determine which one is the most powerful of all. The final table opens in a few minutes and you will be joining it. Who will win the £1,000 reserved for the winner?

In Divinare — pronounced "di-vin-AH-ray", with the stress on the penultimate syllable — the players play the part of famous mediums who must attempt to divine the cards held by their opponents. In each round, only two-thirds of the cards — representing the four divination methods of chiromancy, crystallomancy, tasseomancy and astromancy — are dealt out, and are then revealed little-by-little, giving the players the possibility of narrowing their predictions. A good prediction will allow the players to win points, but guess wrong and you may be forced to take a penalty. The player with the most points after a set number of rounds wins.
118418.name: Divinare
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 8: Divinare/Escape: The Curse of the Temple/Board Game Themes
Episodio 6 – A Touch of Evil y ¿tema o mecánica?
ET107: De Reseñador a Adivino pasando por Descubridor
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 44!!! The EPIC Week!!!

118419.name: Windgeflüster (Issue 22 - Aug 1993)
118419.description: This issue contains an article about name giving for heroes. It also contains an article about vikings. An article about the Avalon Hill RPG "Lords of Creation" and news and reviews of new RPG stuff.

118421.name: Windgeflüster (Issue 23 - Okt 1993)
118421.description: This issue conatins a report of the GenCon '93 Milwaukee. Some adventure ideas with new NSCs. An article of Chivalry & Sorcery and news, reviews of new RPG stuff.

118422.name: Eight Forces
118422.description:
User Summary

Eight Forces is a scrolling airplane shoot 'em up. As with most games of the genre, it features dual play, masses of enemies, various power ups and bombs.

Fight your way through enemies and levels to face ever harder bosses and eventually the final boss and end of the game.

118424.name: Super Pinball Action
118424.description:
User Summary

Super Pinball Action is a video pinball game from Tecmo. The cabinet is similar in shape to a real pinball game, but with a shorter playfield. Features standard pinball action without the electronics and physical ball.

118425.name: Windgeflüster (Issue 24 - Dec 1993)
118425.description: This issue contains an article of hints for GMs. Also an article/review of Conan RPG by TSR. It also contains a special NSC for an adventure idea.

118426.name: V-Goal
118426.description:
User Summary

V-Goal is a head to head soccer game from Tecmo. Features standard soccer rules and scoring. Add more quarters to get more play time. Score the most goals to win.

118427.name: Zing Zing Zip
118427.description:
User Summary

Zing Zing Zip is another scrolling airplane shoot 'em up from Tecmo. Fly your ship collecting power ups like lasers, missles and bombs. Use your weapons to destroy planes, tanks and other enemies. Fight bosses at the end of each level to continue. Fight the final boss to end the game.

118428.name: Ace Driver
118428.description:
User Summary

Ace Driver is a sit down racing game from Namco. Cabinets are set up for 2 players to go head to head. Race on various tracks and try to beat your opponent and the clock to continue.

118429.name: Windgeflüster (Issue 25 - Apr 1994)
rpgissuearticle: Es war einmal vor langer Zeit in einer weit, weit entfernten Galaxies....
118429.description: This issue is a Star Wars special with articles, reviews of RPG stuff, novels and an adventure.

118430.name: Windgeflüster (Issue 26 - Jun 1994)
118430.description: This issue contains an article about pirates. And a short adventure "Rache über den Tod hinaus"

118431.name: Horizon Riders
118431.description:
